She is very kind and hard-working, and lives with her parents-in-law where she does everything she can to have a better quality of life and give her family all the best.  Medali sells fish for a living.  Every day she gets up early to go to the port to buy the freshest, largest fish.  From there she goes to the city market where she has a small stall.  There she begins cleaning the fish and displaying it to the public.  

She has very good customers who have been loyal since the very first day of business.  Her charisma and kindness make them always return to her.  She has been in business for five years with her husband's help and, together, they make a good team.  She very much enjoys what she does since she has the afternoons off and uses the time to help her children with their homework and other activities.

She hopes to expand her business and grow enough to continue improving her economic situation.  This is her third loan through MFP and she is happy to be able to count on the financial support.  This will give her the confidence to advance in her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time, as with previous loans.  She enjoys being part of the communal bank because all of the members are very responsible, supportive people.

The 1,500 PEN loan will be used to buy fish and trays to display the products.  She also wants to upgrade her food stall.

loans.use: To buy fish and trays, and to upgrade her food stall.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La sra. Herminia tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el barrio el porvenir de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, todos los dias se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana para empezar su produccion, cuando termina la elaboracion de las tortillas sale a venderlas a lugares cercanos de su casa de habitacion, tiene muchos clientes ya que sus tortillas son grandes y sabrosas.
Herminia es madre de 4 hijos, los cuales los tiene estudiando en el centro educativo de la comunidad, la meta de Herminia es graduar a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales.
Herminia cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
En sus tiempos libres Herminia y su familia visitan la iglesia.
El credito lo invertira en  compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia, 36, lives in the Porvenir neighborhood in the city of Choluteca.  She makes and sells tortillas for a living.  Every day she gets up at 4:30 a.m. to begin production.  When she has finished making the tortillas she goes out to sell them near her home.  She has many customers because her tortillas are large and delicious.

Herminia is the mother of four children who study at the community educational center.  Herminia's goal is for her children to graduate and become good professionals.  Her husband helps cover household expenses.  In her free time, Herminia and her family go to church.

She plans to use the loan to buy corn, firewood, quicklime and water.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, quicklime and water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a comal (flat earthenware pan) to make tortillas

loans.name: Reyneria

texts.es: Reyneria, de 60 años, es una mujer muy valiente y luchadora, toda su vida se la paso trabajando mucho para así poder sacar adelante a sus ocho hijos a quienes dio educación y crío junto a su esposo. Con el tiempo sus hijos crecieron y ahora son independientes. Ahora ella vive a lado de dos de sus hijos y su esposo con quien sigue trabajando mucho para poder tener una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Reyneria consiste en la venta de comida,  por las mañanas desde muy temprano sale al mercado en busca de las frutas y verduras mas frescas y nutritivas para así tener lo mejor de lo mejor para sus fieles comensales, quienes van a su local en busca de los diversos y deliciosos platos innovadores que prepara. Por las mañanas solo vende jugos y algunos sándwiches, mientras que a partir de las 10 am comienza con la venta de menú, todo su trabajo lo realiza en su casa en donde acondiciono algunas mesas y sillas para recibir a sus clientes. Además de esto también vende bebidas gaseosas, todo su trabajo lo hace sola ya que su esposo trabaja en otras actividades. Le esta yendo muy bien, gana un buen porcentaje de lo que invierte y siente que el esfuerzo que tuvo al principio de trabajar solo para recuperar su inversión ahora le esta dando frutos, ya que tiene clientes que se los gano durante estos 15 años que lleva realizando éste trabajo. Ahora se prepara para mejorar su infraestructura y dar mejores comodidades a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que seguirá siendo la socia buena y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará ingredientes no perecible y vivieres para así tener en grandes cantidades y no tener que ir al mercado muy seguido en busca de ellos, además comprará bebidas para seguir vendiendo.
texts.en: Reyneria is 60 years old. She is a brave woman and a fighter. She has worked hard her whole life to be able to get her 8 children ahead. She gave them an education and raised them with her husband. In time, her children grew and now they are on their own. Now she lives with two of her children and her husband, with whom she still works a lot to be able to have a good life. Reyneria's job is selling food. She goes out early in the morning to the market seeking fruit and vegetables to be able to have the best for her faithful customers. They go to her locale seeking the varied and delicious and innovative dishes she makes. She only sells juices and some sandwiches in the morning and at 10 she begins to sell from the menu. She does all her work at her house where she set up some tables and chairs to receive customers. In addition, she also sells soft drinks. She does all the work herself, since her husband works at other activities. It is going very well for her. She makes a good percentage of what she invests and she feels that the effort she made at the beginning just to get her investment back is getting results now. She has customers that she earned during those 15 years that she has been doing this job. Now she is preparing to improve her infrastructure and make things more comfortable for her customers. This will be loan number 5 with MFP. She is very happy that she will have financial support to keep increasing her working capital. She is also convinced that she will continue being the good and responsible member she was with the previous loans. She likes belonging to the communal bank since they are all responsible and supportive of each other. With the amount she has asked for of 2500 soles, she will buy non-perishable ingredients and produce in large quantities so she doesn't have to go to the market so often, as well as buy beverages to keep selling.

loans.use: to buy meat and products such as soft drinks, to have ready to prepare her food.

loans.name: Santos Azucena

texts.es:
La sra. Santos Azucena tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el barrio el porvenir de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas de maiz, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para empezar su produccion, cuando termina la produccion reparte sus tortillas en zonas cercanas a su casa de habitacion, tambien tiene pedidos por encargo.
Santos Azucena es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales los tiene estudiando en el centro educativo de la comunidad.
Santos Azucena tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.  
El credito lo invertira en compra de maiz, cal, agua y leña.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
su meta es graduar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Azucena, age 40, lives in the Porvenir neighborhood of the city of Choluteca.  She makes and sells corn tortillas.  She has been doing this type of work for several years.  She gets up at four in the morning every day in order to start her production.  When she finishes her production she delivers her tortillas in the zones that are close to her house.  She also has orders to fill.

Santos Azucena has three children.  They go to school at their community educational center.

Santos Azucena also raises chickens and pigs.

She will use the loan to buy corn, lime powder, water, and firewood.  She needs the income to get her family ahead.

Her goal is for her children to graduate.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, water, and firewood.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: El Joven Rodrigo es un joven emprendedor, soltero su domicilio se encuentra en la zona Barrientos,  vive en la casa de sus abuelos  hace 10 años,  se dedica al comercio de zapatillas, sandalia de mujer y hombre, tiene su puesto en  el mercado de la zona, realiza su venta  6 veces a la semana menos los días sábados, los días de feria en la localidad de  sacaba son  los días jueves y domingo, el préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de mercadería en zapatos por mayor  para estas fiestas navideñas y de fin de año, esta es la única actividad de joven que le ayuda a mantenerse y mantener a sus abuelos, a pesar de ser tan joven tiene que correr con la responsabilidad e ver a su abuelos, se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is an enterprising young man.  He is single, and his home is in the Barrientos zone.  He has lived in his grandparents’ house for ten years.  He sells women’s and men’s shoes and sandals.  He has a stall at the market that is in the zone.

He makes his sales six times a week, but not on Saturdays.  Thursdays and Sundays are the local fair days.

He will use the loan to buy wholesale footwear for the festivities this Christmas and New Year .

This is the only activity that he has to help support himself and his grandparents.  In spite of being so young, he has to bear the responsibility and see to his grandparents.  

He is very grateful for the opportunity being given to him through this loan.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 47 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora, es madre de cuatro hijos quienes tres ya son mayores de edad y solo uno el menor de 16 años vive a su lado y al de su esposo en su casa propia. Ella trabaja mucho para poder mejorar su condicion de vida. El trabajo de Rosa, consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas a personas mayores de edad, además de esto también se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches y cuando tiene un tiempo disponible se va por los ríos a los diferentes caseríos a realizar otra actividad, que es la venta de diferente mercadería. Lleva realizando este trabajo por cinco años, trabaja sola y se siente muy bien ya que tiene muy buenos ingresos y eso le permite poder dar la tranquilidad necesaria para su familia.
Antes de poder realizar estas actividades, Rosa tenía muchas dificultades con respecto a sus ingresos, ya que dependía mucho de su esposo quien a veces no tenía lo suficiente. Así que ella quiso dar un aporte a la economía y logró así poder iniciar con este trabajo que le permite mejorar sus ingresos y poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida. Desea poder seguir trabajando para así progresar y surgir, su plan más cercano es el de mejorar su infraestructura. Este será el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por que es muy responsable y solidaria. Espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para ella y seguir aumentando su negocio, esta convencida que seguirá siendo una socia muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, además de ingredientes para seguir con la venta de comida y mercadería para con la venta de dichos productos.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 47, is a kind, good, and very hard-working woman.  She has four children, and three of them are adults.  Only the youngest child, age 16, lives with her and her husband in their own house.

She works a lot in order to be able to improve her living conditions.  Rosa sells soft drinks and beer to adults.  Also, she sells food in the evenings.  When she has free time she goes by the rivers to the different settlements to do another business activity, selling different merchandise.  She has been doing this work for five years.  She works alone.  She feels very good because she has very good income, and this allows her to be able to give her family the peace of mind that they need.

Before being able to do these business activities Rosa had a lot of difficulties regarding their income.  She depended on her husband a lot, and at times he did not have enough.  That is why she wanted to make a contribution to their finances.  She managed to be able to start this work.  It allows her to improve her income and to be able to aspire to a better quality of life.

She wants to be able to continue working in order to progress and get ahead.  Her plan for the near future is to improve her infrastructure.  This will be her eighth loan with MFP.  She has always been a good member of her communal bank.  They are very fond of her because she is very responsible and supportive.  She hopes that she is able to get the loan because it will be a help to her to continue increasing her business.  She is convinced that she will continue being a very punctual member.  She will make her payments on time like she did with all of the previous loans that she had.

She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy soft drinks and beer.  She will also buy ingredients to continue selling food and merchandise to sell the aforementioned products.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, beer, and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La sra. Maria vive en el barrio el porvenir de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, muchos de sus clientes la prefieren ya que sus tortillas son grandes y de buen sabor, todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para empezar su produccion y luego salir a venderlas, trabaja de lunes a sabado.
Maria es madre de 1 hijo y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar. juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante.
Maria tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
El credito lo invertira en compra de maiz, agua, cal y leña.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the neighbourhood of El Porvenir in the city of Choluteca. She makes a living making and selling tortillas. She has been in this business for several years and many of her customers favour her tortillas as they are big and taste good. Every day she gets up very early to start making the tortillas and later she goes out to sell them. She works from Monday to Saturday.

Maria is the mother and one child and she receives the support of her husband to cover the household expenses. Together they work hard to get ahead.

Maria also makes a living by raising chickens.

With this loan she will invest in buying corn, water, lime and firewood.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, water and firewood.

loans.name: Senaida

texts.es: Senaida, de 42 años, es una mujer buena, amable y trabajadora está casada y tiene tres hijos a quienes educo y crió como solo una madre ejemplar lo puede hacer. Sus hijos son mayores e independientes, y ahora solo tiene a cargo suyo un nieto de cuatro años a quien le brinda todo lo que necesita. Ella vive a lado de su nieto y su esposo en una casa propia en donde comparte los deseos de superarse. EL trabajo de Senaida consiste en la venta de comida regional, es muy buena y tiene una exquisita sazón ya que sus fieles clientes lo mencionan como las manos mágicas de la calle. Entre los platos de comida que ofrece a su publico tiene Juanes, cecina, patashca, entre otros. Todo su trabajo lo hace en la vereda de su casa desde donde inicia su día laboral a las 4 de la tarde y vende a las 11. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 4 años, le va muy bien y espera poder continuar haciendo por mucho mas. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que aparte de que le genera buenos ingresos también le relaja y le permite disponer de su tiempo por las mañana ya que así puede ver a su nieto, al principio cuando se inicio se dio con la sorpresa de no saber bien el manejo de este negocio, pero con el tiempo logró seguir el ritmo y ahora no tiene ninguna dificultad en hacer sus cosas. Tiene mucho metas trazadas pero por ahora solo desea poner una tienda de abarrotes que le permita tener un ingreso adicional. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que seguirá siendo la socia beuna y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará ingredientes para continuar con su venta de productos, además de cambiar algunos platos y cubiertos.
texts.en:
42-year old Senaida is a fine, friendly, hardworking woman. She is married and has three children whom she brought up as only an exemplary mother can. Her children are adults now and live away from home, but she is still responsible for a 4-year old grandson for whom she provides whatever is needed. Senaida lives with her grandson and husband in their own home where they share a common wish to get on in life.

Senaida earns her living by selling local food. It is so tasty and full of flavour that her loyal customers believe she has the hands of a street magician. She sells a variety of dishes including juanes (leaves stuffed with fish, chicken etc), meats, and patashka (soup made from beef and mutton). She does all her work on the path close to her house. Her work day begins at 4pm and she sells her wares until 11pm. She’s been doing this work for four years, and as all is going well, she hopes to continue for many more years.

Senaida enjoys her work a lot, and apart from the fact that she earns a good income from it, she finds it relaxing and it allows her time in the mornings to spend with her grandson. At the beginning she found that she didn’t really know how to run a business, but as time went on, she got into a routine and now she doesn’t have any problems. 

Senaida has many goals but for the moment her sole desire is to open a corner store to bring in extra income. This will be her third loan with MFP, and she is very happy to have this financial support. She is certain that she will continue to be a good responsible member, just as she has been in the past. She enjoys being part of the community bank as the other members are all responsible, committed people. With the S/.800 loan she will buy ingredients for the food she makes and also new plates and cutlery.

loans.use: buy ingredients for the food she makes and also new plates and cutlery

loans.name: Yolanda Marina

texts.es: Yolanda Marina es una emprendedora exitosa, ya que cumplió su objetivo de tener su propio negocio que es la venta de ropa nueva, tiene experiencia en el negocio y sobre todo sabe que es lo que los clientes le buscan eso le permite a ella que la visiten por la calidad de ropa que le ofrece y la atención. No es la primera vez que solicita crédito a Fundación León 2000 y ella ha mostrado ser una persona responsable y sobre todo cumplir sus objetivos que se propone. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en mercadería para esta temporadas buenas.
texts.en: Yolanda Marina is a successful entrepreneur because she reached her goal of having her own business selling new clothes.  She has experience in the business and above all knows what customers are looking for which leads them to visit her because of the quality of the clothes she offers and the service.  This is not her first loan request to Fundación León 2000 and she’s shown herself to be a responsible person who above all reaches the objectives she sets out for herself.  She is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise for these good seasons.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marina Roberta

texts.es:
La señora Marina Roberta es soltera, tiene 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la artesanía a la confección de delantales y gabachas, inició este negocio con sus padre y hasta ahora lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas, y mejorar solo así su negocio, y sus ganancias, en el futuro espera ver un negocio amplio.
texts.en: Marina Roberta, 50, never had the opportunity to attend school.  She works crafting aprons and “gabachas” [a type of apron or overall].  She started the business with her parents and to date has ten years’ experience in it.  She’s asking for a loan to buy fabric to improve her business and profits and in the future she hopes to see an expanded business.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mill.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, de 37 años, es una mujer buena y amable, esta casada y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales 2 ya son mayores e independientes y tres menores de 11, 7 años y uno de 9 meses, ellos dependen de ella y su esposo para poder tener una mejor calidad vida. El trabajo de Zoila consiste en la venta de pescado, todos los días desde las 4 de la madrugada sale en busca de los mejores productos para dirigirse a las diferentes calles de la ciudad y vender éste alimento. Cuando inició con su trabajo aún recuerda que lo hacía con una pequeña bandeja que máximo entraban 10 kilos, ahora creció mucho desde entonces y vende en bandejas llenas de aproximadamente 120 kilos durante al día. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 6 años y tiene la satisfacción de vender mucho.
Todo su trabajo lo realiza sola y en algunos casos tiene la ayuda de sus hijos, empezó a realizar esta actividad con la necesidad de tener mejores ingresos en la economía del hogar, y gracias a mucho esfuerzo pudo consolidarse como una de las vendedoras de pescado más solicitadas en las calles pues sus clientes la esperan a diario para poder comprar sus pescados frescos. Espera seguir creciendo más y trasladar su venta en su propia casa. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, además está muy comprometida una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el anterior crédito que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos para seguir con su venta, además de refaccionar y cambiar algunos materiales que utiliza en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Zoila, 37, is a good, kind woman.  She’s married and has five children two of which are already independent adults and three minors who are 11 and 7 years old and a 9-month-old.  They depend on her and her husband to have a better quality of life.

Zoila’s work consists in selling fish.  She goes out every day at 4am to seek out the best products to then head for the streets in the city to sell this food.  When she started out with her work she remembers that she did it with a small tray that only held 10 kilos.  Since then she’s grown quite a bit and now sells trays full with about 120 kilos during the day.  She’s been in business six years and has the satisfaction of selling a lot.

She does all her work alone though sometimes gets help from her children.  She started this business needing to earn better income for her family and thanks to much effort was able to consolidate herself into one of the most sought after fish sellers in the street because her customers wait for her daily to buy her fresh fish.  She hopes to continue to grow more and move her sales into her house.

This will be MFP loan #3.  She’s happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel sure to get ahead with her business this way.  Besides, she’s very committed once more to make her installment payments like she did with her previous loan.  She will use the requested amount to buy more products to continue with her sales as well as to renew and replace some of the materials she uses in her work.

loans.use: to buy more fish and trays and other supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fredy Fernando

texts.es:
el señor Fredy Fernando  es soltero, tiene 20 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica al comercio a la venta de calzados, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, tiene 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mas mercadería, ya que entre mas productos cuenta, mejores  ventas realiza y obtiene mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Fredy Fernando, 20, is single; he never attended school.  He is a merchant; he sells shoes.  He has the support of his parents and has three years’ experience.  He’s asking for a loan that he’ll use to buy more merchandise since the more products he has on hand, the better sales he’ll have and obtain better profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Maria del Socorro tiene 52 años de edad, su negocio a la que se dedica es a brindar los servicio de video juego que mas todo un entretenimiento para muchos jóvenes que la visitan, este  lo inicio con el objetivo de generar ingresos para la familia y además tiene la venta de refrescos en el mismo local. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar equipos de videos juegos para brindarle a sus clientes variedad de juegos y estén satisfechos.
texts.en: María del Socorro, 52, has a business providing video game services which more than anything is an entertainment for the many youngsters who visit her.  She started it with the goal of generating family income; she also sells refreshments in the same place.  She is currently asking for a loan to buy video game kits to provide a variety of games for her customers so that they will be satisfied.

loans.use: to buy video game equipment.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La señora Ana, es una humilde agricultora de la zona de San Ignacio, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al cultivo de café , la mayor afectación que se le presento fue las fuertes lluvia combinadas con las cenizas del volcán , lo que provoco que los granos de café y las flor que venia naciendo se callera , por ende se perdido en su totalidad el cultivo ;  Ella con mucho esfuerzo logro pagar su primer financiamiento , ahora no tiene dinero con que comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para inducir la plantación y prevenir futuras perdidas .Lo cual solicita apoyo de Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva para ser beneficiada y seguir trabajando ; ya que es el único recurso con el que cuenta para el pan de cada día . Los sueños de doña Ana es poder diversificar cultivos y construir su humilde vivienda para vivir dignamente .
texts.en:
Ana is a humble farmer in the San Ignacio zone.  She’s been growing coffee for a long time.  The greatest challenge she faced was the strong rains combined with ash from the volcano which caused the coffee beans and the flowers that were budding to fall off thus losing her entire crop.  

With much effort she was able to repay her first loan and now does not have any money to buy fertilizer and supplies needed to start a new crop and avoid future losses.  

She is asking Afodenic for help through Kiva funds so that she can be benefitted and can continue working since this is the only resource she has for daily bread.  Ana’s dreams are to diversify her crops and to build a humble abode to live in with dignity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 42 años, convive con Ercilio de 32 años, con quien tiene 3 hermosos hijos. Juntos viven viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Dolores es una persona entusiasta experta para los negocios, ella se dedica en la venta de prendas de vestir, éste oficio viene realizando hace 8 años atrás. Ella al principio, sus prendas lo vendía en un mercado peuqeño de su ciudad, encima de unos maderos y plásticos cosa que le era dificultoso en trasladar las prendas, inclusive los tenía que doblar, empacar pues  por tanto manipular las prendas se maltratan. Pues ahora ya cuenta con un local propio y es gracias al ingreso de sus ventas que logró construirlo. Actualmente es conocida y todos sus clientes acuden a su puesto, esa es la ventaja que ella tiene pues está contenta con éste trabajo. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará mas prendas de vestir  y ampliara su local.
texts.en:
Dolores, 42, lives with Ercilio, 32; they have three beautiful children.  They live together in their own house located in the settlement of Canayre in Llochegua District.  

Dolores is an enthusiastic person expert in business.  She sells clothes.  She’s been in business for 8 years.  At the beginning, she sold her articles of clothing in a small market in her city on top of some boards and plastic which made transporting her clothes difficult.  She had to fold and pack them and with so much handling, they would become damaged.  Now, she has her own locale and thanks to income from the sales she managed to build it.  She is well-known now and all her customers come to her stand.  That’s her advantage and she’s happy with this work.

This will be her 4th MFP loan and she pledges to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the 3000 new soles to buy articles of clothing and to enlarge her locale.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and to buy materials to enlarge her locale.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Juana , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual actualmente labora en una empresa privada para solventar algunos gastos del hogar , doña Juana desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al cultivo de piña , la gran afectación que se le presenta es que por falta de ingresos no  puede abonar su cultivo ya que este carece de fertilizantes e  insumos necesarios para obtener una producción de calidad , los planes hacia un futuro es renovar un cuarto de manzana de piña de diferente especie como la MD2 , muy conocida como piña GOLDEN. 
Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva ya que sin ellos no fuese posible que muchos agricultores de las zonas rurales pudieran mejorar su calidad de vida ya que la agricultura es su fuente de recurso económico para sobrevivir .
texts.en:
Juana lives in Ticuantepe with her husband who currently works for a private firm in order to meet some household expenses.  Juana has been growing pineapples for a long time.   The great challenge she faces is lack of income.  She’s unable to fertilize her crops because she lacks fertilizer and supplies needed to produce quality harvests.  Her plans for the future are to renovate a quarter of a manzana [unit of land measurement] of pineapples of different species like the MD2 which is widely known as Golden pineapple.

She is grateful for the help Afodenic provides through Kiva funds because without it many farmers in rural areas would find it impossible to improve their quality of life since farming is their source of income to survive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Cinthia Jacqueline

texts.es: Cinthia Jacqueline tiene 22 años de edad ,ella tiene un negocio que lo inicio con cuenta propia en el cual la venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos, ella lo inicia con capital propio  y su  mama  que se encuentra en  costa rica le ayudo para que tuviera una herramienta de trabajo y pueda ella salir adelante. Cinthia está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de  variedad de ropa y cosméticos y seguir ofreciéndole a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cinthia Jacqueline, 22, has a business she initiated on her own in which she sells new clothing and cosmetics. She began with her own capital, and her mom who is in Costa Rica helped her get the proper tools so she could go forward with the business. 

Cinthia is requesting a loan to invest in the business. She will purchase a variety of clothing and cosmetics for selling to her customers as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia de 30 años de edad casado con prudencio de 37 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Lidia es una madre, que se dedica a las labores domesticas pero al mismo tiempo se dedica a la agricultura. Esta labor lo realiza junto a su querido esposo, que cultivan cacao y maíz desde ya hace más de 12 años. Ella cuenta que el producto que más rentabilidad le genera es el cacao, mientras que el maíz es una ayuda porque es una planta estacionaria, solo se cultiva los meses de enero y  febrero para venderlos en los meses de junio y julio mientras que el cacao se cosecha cada 15 días, pero cuando la producción es baja se cosecha cada dos meses, por supuesto que también el volumen de producción es minima.
Lidia está contenta con esta labor que realiza, ya que gracias a sus productos logró construir su vivienda.
En un futuro próximo desea dedicarse a realizar un negocio en la venta de prendas de vestir. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, para ello contratará peones y comprar sacos de abono.
texts.en:
30-year old Lidia is married to 37-year old Prudencio and they have four children. They live in the highly populated centre of Canayre in the district of Llochegua. As well as being a mother with daily chores to perform, Lidia also works on her farm. She and her beloved husband have grown cocoa and corn for more than twelve years. The cocoa crop brings in the most money, while the corn brings in less as it is a seasonal crop and can only be planted in January and February and sold in June and July. Cocoa, on the other hand, is harvested every two weeks--unless production is low and then it is harvested every two months. 

Lidia is happy with this work; with the income she has managed to build her own house. In the near future she wants to start a business selling clothing. This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to make her repayments punctually. With the S/.1,000 loan she will hire labourers to work on the farm and also buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to hire labourers and buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Micaela es casada, tiene 33 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inició este trabajo como operaria en otro negocio, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción de vivienda.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de un telar, y tener otra persona trabajando, en este nuevo telar, ya que espera mejorar y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Gloria Micaela is married, 33 years old, finished her primary school education, and has one child. She devotes herself to weaving traditional clothing and began this business as an agent in another business. She has ten years of experience to date, and counts on the support of her husband who works in housing construction. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase a loom, and to have another person working on this new loom, since she hopes to improve and continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a loom and hire another person to work the loom.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 8 y 3 años la mayor  estudia en escuela. El marido es taxista.

Ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en Manta en el cual vende zapatos y sandalias de todo tipo, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, nos cuenta que a veces se le hace muy difícil realizar este trabajo pero que lo hace por el bien de sus pequeñas hijas, trabaja con la ayuda de su cuñado que es quien se queda a cargo del trabajo cuando ella tiene que ir a atender  a sus hijas. Lleva 4 años con su negocio y  ha crecido mucho. Los productos los comprar en Guayaquil cada fin de mes.

Este crédito es para comprar más zapatos y sandalias  de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Está  en el Banco Comunal hace mas de  4 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito ella empezó en parte su negocio que le está brindando buenas satisfacciones. 

Sus sueños son tener un local más grande y propio ya que arrienda donde vende.
texts.en:
In the site of La Pila in Montecristi the communal bank Para el Futuro De la Mujer [For the Future of Woman] meets every two weeks. This place is well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture. A great variety of handicraft may be found here, created by its inhabitants who follow the traditional customs. 

This is where María, 29, lives, who is in a committed relationship by which she has two daughters, 8 and 3 years of age, the eldest of whom goes to school. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

She makes a living in commerce. She has a place in Manta where she sells all kinds of shoes and sandals. She works every day from 8:30 am until 5 pm. She tells us that sometimes it is very hard for her to do this work but she does it for the good of her young daughters. She works with the help of her brother-in-law who is the person who remains in charge of the work when she must go to tend to her daughters. She has been in her business for four years and has grown considerably. She buys her products in Guayaquil at the end of each month.

This loan is for purchasing more shoes and sandals of all types and styles to stock her business. She has been with the communal bank for more than four years and likes it because with the first loan she partially started up this business of hers that is bringing her good satisfaction. 

Her dream is to have a larger shop of her own, since she is renting the place from which she sells.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Marjorie Maricela

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maryorie, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 7, 5 y 3 años de edad los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella además de estar al tanto de sus pequeños hijos y del hogar también se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende todo tipo de cerámicas y adornos, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, las artesanías las compra a artesanos de la zona pero sin terminar  ya que así les sale más barato, luego ella las pinta y les da el toque final para venderla a sus clientes a muy buen precio. Lleva 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanías, pinturas, pinceles y laca para darles el acabado correcto. Lleva más de dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a salir adelante en muchos momentos difíciles.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito pues con ellos que ha podido salir adelante en su negocio y con esto a podido mejorar su situación económica y familiar ya que hay menos problemas económicos y así todo mejora, con esto ha podido darle mejores cosas  a sus hijos, ahora espera este crédito para seguir adelante en su negocio y así mejorando también su vida.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The members of the Para el Futuro de la Mujer Community Bank meet every two weeks in La Pila, in the canton of Montecristi. It is an area well known in the province and country for its rich cultural traditions where many types of crafts are still made by the local people in traditional ways.

23-year old Sra Marjorie lives and works here. She is married and has three children aged 7, 5, and 3. The two oldest attend school. Her husband is a businessman. As well as looking after the children and taking care of the home, Marjorie runs a small shop where she sells all types of ceramics and ornaments. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.. She buys unfinished crafts from local people since it is cheaper this way, and she then paints and finishes the crafts and sells them to her customers at a good price. She has been in business for four years and it has gone very well.

The loan will be used to buy crafts, paints, brushes and varnish for her to give the proper finish to the crafts. She has been involved in the community bank for two years, and the loans she has received have helped her get through difficult moments.

Marjorie is seeking another loan to invest in her business so that she can improve her financial and family situation. With fewer economic worries, everything improves. She has been able to give her children better things. Now she hopes that this loan too will help with her business and thus with her life.

Her dream is to get ahead in the business and in the community bank.

loans.use: To buy crafts, paint, brushes and varnish.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es: Marivel tiene 31 años, convive con claudio de 40 años, fruto de este amor tienen 5 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de Llochegua. Marivel es una excelente vendedora de pollos, cuenta que al inicio empezó vendiendo 10 pollos diarios, Luego fue superando gracias a la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes. Los pollos los compra en el puerto, que esta a una distancia de 4 kilómetros donde hay se tiene que ir con bote surcando el río Mantaro. Es así que ella trae los pollos para expenderlo a un buen precio. Mientras que su querido esposo también le apoya en las ventas, inclusive es el encargado de repartir a los restaurantes. Maribel está feliz con su negocio ya que es el único ingreso que ella tiene. En un futuro próximo desea crecer su negocio. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles invertirá en la compra de más pollos.
texts.en:
Marivel is 31 years old. She lives with Claudio who is 40 years old and they have five children together. They live in their own house located in the town of Canayre in the Llochegua district. Marivel is extremely good at selling chickens. She says that when she began, she was selling ten chickens a day. Subsequently this increased, thanks to the good service she provides to her customers. 

She buys the chickens in the port, which is four kilometres away. She travels by means of the Mantaro river with a container. This is how she collects the chickens to sell them at a good price. Meanwhile her beloved husband supports her with selling the chickens as well as being responsible for delivering them to restaurants. Maribel is happy with her business since it is the only income she has. In the near future she would like to grow her business. This will be her third loan with MFP, and she is committed to promptly settling her repayments. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Maricela Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maricela, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  2 y de 1 año de edad. Su esposo es Economista y trabaja en una empresa.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Nos cuenta que realiza sus recorridos todas las tardes ya que a esa hora su esposo ya está en la casa y puede cuidar a sus pequeños hijos, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada quince días. La mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene dos  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien y fue  con el primer crédito que empezó su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  dos años y medio y le gusta porque gracias a su primer crédito empezó su negocio.

Ella va a repetir el crédito para comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Nos cuenta que los créditos son muy importantes para ella ya que es así como se financiar y puede con esto ganar algo para el bien de su familia, nos cuenta que sus ventas han mejorado mucho con el paso de los días, en especial en este mes en el cual sus ventas aumentan mucho.
 
Sus sueños es seguir realizando sus ventas y tener un local donde vender.
texts.en:
In La Pila in Montecristi, the “Para el Futuro de la Mujer” Communal Bank meets every two weeks. This area is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture. It is where the inhabitants produce a large variety of handicrafts according to customary traditions. 

Sra. Maricela, 25, is married and has two children, ages 2 and 1. Her husband is an economist and works for a company. She sells all kinds of clothing by going door to door and she also has customers she knows well come to her home to make purchases. She also takes orders from her clients. She sells door to door during the afternoons when her husband is at home and can care for the children. She provides credit and collects payments every two weeks. She buys merchandise in Guayaquil whenever necessary. She has been doing this work for two years and it has been going very well. She started her business with her first loan and has been a member of the communal bank for two and a half years. She enjoys it because, thanks to the bank, she was able to start her business.

Maricela is asking for another loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses t-shirts and childrens’ clothing. She notes that the loans are very important to her since that is how she has been able to get financing and earn something to benefit her family. She adds that her sales have improved greatly over time, especially during this month when her sales have greatly expanded.

Her dreams are to continue making sales and to have a shop from which to make her sales.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing..

loans.name: Blanca Mónica

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 9 y 4 años  de edad. Los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es empleado público.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Nos cuenta que realiza sus recorridos todas las mañanas ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela y solo tiene que llevar al más pequeño, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada quince días. La mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  4 ciclos  y le gusta porque con los crédito ella puede comprar sus productos al contado y así le dan más descuentos con lo cual le queda más ganancias.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique o un bazar.
texts.en:
In La Pila in Montecristi, the “Para el Futuro de la Mujer” Communal Bank meets every two weeks. This area is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture. It is where the inhabitants produce a large variety of handicrafts according to customary traditions. 

Sra. Blanca, 33, is married and has three children, ages 14, 9 and 4. The older two attend secondary and elementary school. Her husband is a public employee.

She sells all types of clothing by going door to door and she also has well known clients who come to her home to make purchases. She goes door to door every morning when her older children are in school and she only has to bring along her youngest. She sells her items on credit and collects payments every two weeks. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever necessary. She has  been making sales for 10 years and it has been going very well.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing. She has been a member of the Communal Bank through four loan cycles and she enjoys it because the loans enable her to pay cash for her products and receive more discounts so that she earns  more profit.   

Her dream is to own a boutique or a clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Yenny Maribel

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yenny, tiene 45 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva cuatro años en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la ayuda para poder seguir con su negocio y sacar adelante a su hijo.

Ella para ganar su sustento propio y el de su pequeño hijo se dedica al comercio, hace 8 años junto todos los recursos que tenia arreglo un pequeño local en el cual surtió una pequeña tienda de comestibles para lo cual compro todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, para ofrecer a sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Tiene 8 años con su local y nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes que realizan sus compras diarias en su local.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito y lo va a emplear en surtir aun mas su tienda, va a comprar ciertos artículos de bazar para también vender estos productos, nos cuenta que con los créditos su vida ha mejorado mucho ya que como es separada ella tiene que ver que a su hijo no le falte nada y con su negocio ella lo logra ya que gana lo suficiente para sacar adelante sola a su hijo y sin tener que descuidarlo ya que su negocio está en casa y no tiene que salir para conseguir el dinero. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que a su hijo nunca le falte nada.
texts.en:
In La Pila in the Montecristi canton, the "Para el Futuro De la Mujer " communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture.  Here you can find a great variety of crafts made by the inhabitants, following traditional customs. 

Here we met Yenny. She is 45, divorced and has a ten year-old son who is in school. She lives in her parents' house. She has been in the communal bank for four years, and likes it because it helps her continue with her business and raise her child.

To support herself and her small child, she has a small business. Eight years ago, she put together all the resources she had, and fixed up a small shop  which she stocked as a small grocery store. 

For her store, she bought all types of products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, etc. to sell to her customers. She works everyday from 6:30 am to 9:00pm, and sometimes later. She has had her shop for eight years and tells us that she has a lot of customers who make their daily purchases at her shop.

She is taking out another loan, and is going to use it to stock her store even more. She is going to buy stationery supplies, so that she can also sell these products. 

She tells us that with the loans, her life has improved a lot. As she is separated, she has to see that her child lacks for nothing, and with her business, she is managing to do this. She earns enough to raise her child on her own, and doesn't have to neglect him, since her business is in her home, and she doesn't need to go out to earn money. 

Her goal is to keep moving forward with her business, and for her son to never lack for anything.

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Homer Francisco

texts.es: Homer  Francisco es un emprendedor que lucha día  a día por buscar la comida diaria de su familia proporcionándole los necesario, el ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000,  ha mostrado ser un emprendedor con metas en la vida y en negocio en crecer cada día, nos expresa que gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado ha aumentado su inventario en el negocio y de igual manera sus clientes . Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de mercadería en general  para brindarles a sus clientes una variedad de los productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Homer  Francisco is an entrepreneur who strives day by day to feed his family, and provide them with the basic necessities. He has already had credit with Fundación Leon 2000, and has shown himself to be an entrepreneur with goals in life, in business, and in growing each day. 

He says that thanks to the support that he has been provided, he has increased the inventory of his business, and also his clientele. 

Currently, he is applying for a loan to invest in his business through the purchase of merchandise in general, so that he can offer his customers a variety of the products he sells.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in general.

loans.name: Flor Beatriz

texts.es:
En el sitio la en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Flor, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 2 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
 
Ella es maestra en una  escuela particular de la zona, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella vende los fines de semana y también les vende a sus compañeras y madres de familia en su lugar de trabajo cuando está desocupada, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada 8 días. La mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace  7 años  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y confiables.
 
Sus sueños es tener local y un nombramiento de maestra en una escuela pública.
texts.en:
The "Para el Futuro de la Mujer" communal bank meets every two weeks in La Pila in Montecristi canton. This place is well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture. Here you can find a great variety of crafts made by its inhabitants, following their traditional customs. 

This is where we met Flor. She is 36, married, and has two children, ages eight and two. The eldest one goes to school. Her husband operates a taxi. She is a teacher in a private school in the area, but also works selling clothing of all kinds. 

She sells door-to-door on weekends, and also sells to her co-workers and to mothers at her workplace, when she is unoccupied. She sells her products on credit, and collects every week. She goes to Guayaquil to buy the merchandise every time she needs to.  

She has been working at this activity for more than ten years, and it's going very well.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

She has been in the communal bank for seven years, and likes it because her fellow members are a close-knit group, and are reliable. Her dream is to have a shop, and a teaching position in a public school.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Eulogia Agripina

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Eulogia, tiene 78 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 9 hijos todos mayores  de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual además de vender productos de primera necesidad también venden legumbres, carne, pescado por libras, además de ciertos artículos de bazar, útiles escolares, helados entre otras cosas, trabajan todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que su tienda es una de las primeras que hay en ese lugar y que gracias a Dios se ha mantenido hasta el momento y con ella pudieron sacar adelante a sus hijos. Lleva en su tienda más de 20 años y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, útiles escolares, entre otras cosas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque siempre los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Su sueño es tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In La Pila, in Montecristi canton, the "Para el Futuro De la Mujer " communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture.  Here you can find a great variety of crafts made by the inhabitants, following traditional customs. 

Here we met Eulogia. She is 78, married, and has nine children, all adults and on their own. Her husband is a shopkeeper.

She and her husband have a grocery store in their home, where in addition to selling basic household necessities, they sell vegetables, meat, fish by the pound, and also certain stationery items, school supplies, ice cream, and other things. 

They work every day from 6:30am to 8:00pm. She tells us that their store was one of the first that existed here, and that fortunately, it has kept going until now. With it, they were able to raise their children. 

She has had her store for more than 20 years, and it has gone very well.  She is going to use this loan to further stock her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, school supplies, and other things. 

She has been in the communal bank since the beginning, and likes it because the loans have helped her a lot. Her dream is to be healthy enough to keep  moving forward.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Maryuri Gregoria

texts.es:
Es una joven de 21 años de edad, originaria de León, casada , tiene 2 hijos , de oficio comerciante vende leña y cosméticos  desde hace 5 años , ella junto con su madre salen a vender leña al por mayor y al detalle en barios aledaños de su comunidad, después se dedica a vender cosméticos con estos ingresos es que la joven Maryuri genera ingresos para sostener a su familia.  
Ella solicita el crédito para compra de Leña al por mayor. Pues desea vender mas cantidad donde le soliciten y no dejar de vender por falta de inventario. Ella desea darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos  , el objetivo de ella es hacer mas rentable y productivo su negocio al invertirle mas y hacer  mayor clientela cada día.
texts.en:
Maryuri is a young 21-year old woman from León, married with two children. She works as a merchant selling firewood and cosmetics. For five years she has gone out with her mother to sell firewood wholesale and retail in the neighborhoods around her community, then she sells cosmetics. This income is what young Maryuri makes to support her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale firewood, since she would like to sell greater quantities when requested and not be unable to sell due to lack of inventory. She wants to provide her children with a better future. Her goal is to make her business more profitable and productive by investing more in it and increasing her clientele every day.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Lidia Zoila

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lidia, tiene 47 años de edad, hace tiempo su esposo falleció y no tuvo hijos, ahora ella vive con sus padres que ya están ancianos.

Ella para ganar el sustento diario y con ello ayudar a sus padres  se dedica al comercio, compra y vende de  adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, las artesanías las compra a artesanos de la zona pero sin terminar  ya que así le sale más barato, luego ella los pinta y les da el toque final para venderlas a sus clientes a muy buen precio. Lleva más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien, este negocio lo empezó con su difunto esposo y ahora trabaja sola con la ayuda de sus padres cuando pueden.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía, pinturas, pinceles y laca para darles el acabado correcto. Lleva más de 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezaron su negocio. 

us sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank for Future of the Woman meets every fifteen days in the town of La Pila in Montecristi. This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture, and you can find a wide variety of crafts there made by the inhabitants according to traditional customs.

Here we met Lidia. She is 47 years old, her husband passed away a long time ago, and they had no children. Now she lives with her parents, who are elderly.

To earn her daily living - and with it help out her parents - she does sales, buying and selling ornaments and ceramics. She has a space in her house where she sells all kinds of crafts and she works every day from 8am to 5pm. She buys the crafts from artisans of the area, unfinished though, since they are cheaper that way. Later she paints them and gives them the final touches to sell them to her clients at a very good price. She has been doing this work for 10 years and it has gone very well. She started the business with her deceased husband and now she works alone, with the help of her parents when they are able.

This loan is to purchase more crafts, paint, brushes and lacquer to give them the proper finish. She has been with the Communal Bank for over 10 years and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans.

Her dreams are to move forward with her business and to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy crafts, paints, brushes and lacquer.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jacqueline, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores  de edad, casados y viven en su casa pero independientes. Su esposo es empleado público.
 
Ella hace varios años aprendió corte  confección y tiene un local en su casa en el cual además de tener un taller de costura también tiene  unas cabinas telefónicas en las cuales pasa todo el dia sea controlando las llamadas que realizan sus clientes o cosiendo las prendas que sus clientes le piden. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, lleva 6 años con su local y le gusta porque allí se entretiene y gana algo por su cuenta.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables y unidas. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank for Future of the Woman meets every fifteen days in the town of La Pila in Montecristi. This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture, and you can find a wide variety of crafts there made by the inhabitants according to traditional customs.

Here we met Jacqueline. She is 47 years old and married, with three children who are already grown up and married. They live in her house, though independently. Her husband is a public employee.

She learned to sew some years ago and has a space in her house were, in addition to having a tailoring shop, she also has some phone booths. She spends all day there managing the phone calls made by her clients or sewing the clothes her clients ask of her. She works every day from 8am to 8pm. She has been at this location for 6 years and she likes it because she enjoys it and also earns something for herself.

This loan is for buying cloth, thread, buttons, zippers and other sewing materials. Since the beginning in the Communal Bank she has been the treasurer of the group. She likes it because her partners are very responsible and united.

Her dreams are to move forward with her business and to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, buttons, zippers and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 18 years (in form five, equivalent to the 12th grade in the U.S.) and 9 years (in the 5th grade). His spouse deals in local foodstuffs. He has no additional dependents.

In 1989, Mohamed established his provisions business. He began his business at a very early age because he was not fortunate enough to go to school. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 720,000 every month in profits from this business. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid his first loan, and he now requires a new loan. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. He will use SLL 1,500,000 to buy soft drinks, SLL 1,000,000 to buy Maltina (a brand of beer), and the remainder to buy other provisions. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits to approximately SLL 1,000,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to educate his children to the university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy provisions for his shop.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Juana, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos ellos mayores  de edad, con ella vive una hija que aun es soltera. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo invierta en su negocio, el se dedica fabrican  todo tipo de figuras en barro o en cerámica, trabajan todos los días ya que la demanda de sus productos es muy grande, ellos entregan sus productos a comerciantes de su localidad y de otras ciudades que llegan hasta su taller, nos cuenta que esta es una labor muy bonita porque sus obras son muy apreciadas en muchos lugares del país y fuera de él. Llevan más de 10 años dedicados a esta linda labor y les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arcilla y otros materiales para elaborar sus productos. Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se financian sin tener que pagar tantos intereses.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro.
texts.en:
In La Pila in Montecristi the “Para el Futuro de la Mujer” (For the Future of Women) communal bank meets every two weeks.  This place is very well known in the province and in the country because of its rich traditional culture.  In this place one can find a great variety of crafts that are made by its inhabitants following traditional methods.

We met Juana, 60, here.  She’s married and has six children who are all adults.  She lives with a daughter who is single.  Her husband’s a craftsman.

She is a very good mother and wife and to help her husband she’s taking out the loan to invest in his business.  He makes all sorts of clay or ceramic figurines.  He works every day since demand for his products is high.  They deliver their goods to local merchants and merchants from other cities that come to their workshop.  She tells us that this is a very beautiful work because the items are very much appreciated in many parts of the country and abroad.  They have been doing this beautiful work for more than 10 years and they have done very well.

This loan is to buy clay and other supplies to make the products.  She’s been in the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because the loans are financed without having to pay so much interest.  Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy clay and other supplies.

loans.name: Nancy Olinda

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nancy, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos 10, 6 y 4 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es obrero.

Ella además de ser una gran madre y ama de casa también se dedica al comercio,  vende adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, las cuales compra sin terminar y ella les da un bonito acabado, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, las artesanías las compra a artesanos de la zona ya que según ella son de la mejor calidad que hay. Lleva 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanías, pinturas, laca y otros materiales para darles el acabado correcto. Lleva cinco años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y crecer cada día mas en el.
texts.en:
In La Pila in Montecristi the “Para el Futuro de la Mujer” (For the Future of Women) communal bank meets every two weeks.  This place is very well known in the province and in the country because of its rich traditional culture.  In this place one can find a great variety of crafts that are made by its inhabitants following traditional customs.

We met Nancy, 31, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 10, 6 and 4 years old.  The two oldest attend school and her husband’s a laborer.

Besides being a great mother and housewife she’s also a merchant.  She sells decorations and ceramics.  She has a stand at home where she sells all types of crafts that she buys unfinished and she adds pretty finishing touches to them.  She works every day from 8am until 5pm.  She buys the crafts from local craftsmen because according to her they are the best quality.  She’s been in this line of work for 3 years and has done very well.

This loan is to buy more crafts, paint, lacquer and other supplies to give them the correct finishing.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because interest rates are very low.  Her dream is to stay in business and to grow more in it each day.

loans.use: to buy crafts, paint, lacquer and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Pat, 35, is married and has only one child. He is a farmer who grows rice and cassava as his main income-generating business. However, to better support his daily living he also plants ginger and taro in his backyard to gain extra income. He has been in this business for five years. 

Pat has been with VisionFund for two years, and he successfully paid back his previous loans with VisionFund. He is now requesting another loan with VisionFund. He wants to buy taro and ginger seedlings and to use a portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for his cassava plantation. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his business productivity in order to generate more income to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy taro and ginger seedlings and fertilizer for his plantation.

loans.name: Ith's Group

texts.en:
A villager in a rural area of the Sa Ang district, Ith is a 41-year-old father of two children. To make a living, he grows mushrooms and raises fish to sell in the market. He has been in this business for five years, and it is the main source of income for the family. 

There are two members in Ith’s group. Ith is the second-cycled client while his group member Sokha is the first-cycled client with VisionFund this loan cycle. As the leader of the group, Ith is requesting a loan to buy more fishes and feed, and he will also use a portion of the loan to grow mushrooms. He hopes to increase his business and increase his family's income.

loans.use: To buy more fish, feed, and mushrooms for his business

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
A dweller in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Cambodia, Chin is 54 years old. She and her husband are farmers in the village, and this business has been their main source of income for almost twenty-five years. Chin supplements her income by running a small grocery store in front of her house, selling eggs, detergent, soap, shampoo, biscuits, and other items. 

Chin received a loan from VisionFund one year ago, and she completely repaid her loan. Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She wants to use this loan to buy more grocery items for her store, such as detergent, shampoo, cooking oil, eggs, and soap. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her grocery business and generate a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
A dweller in a village located in the Sa Ang district of Cambodia, Sophorn is a 29-year-old mother of two children who are still in school. She is a businesswoman who buys and sells chickens as her primary business. She has been in this business for ten years. 

Sorphon received a loan from VisionFund two years ago, which she completely paid back. The past loans have helped her to afford sufficient food and to send her children to school regularly. With her business growth, she is now requesting another loan. She will use this loan to buy more chickens for resale. This loan will enable her to increase her chicken business, and she hopes to earn a larger income to support her family and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Sa Ang district, Mao is 43 years old and has three children. She has been growing vegetables and sugarcane with her husband as the family's main source of income to support their living.

Mao has been with VisionFund for five years. The previous loans have helped her to make a better living. She completely paid back her last loan with VisionFund, and she is now requesting another loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her vegetable plantation and also to make pickled vegetables to sell. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her vegetables successfully, and she also hopes to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable plantation.

loans.name: Sovorn's Group

texts.en:
Sovorn is a 38-year-old mother of two children. She lives in a village located in the Sa Ang district, where growing vegetables is commonly the main source of family income. Like other villagers, she has been growing taro as her primary business to support her living. She has been in this business for ten years. 

Sovorn is the second cycled client with VisionFund, and now she leads a borrowers' group of three members who have just joined, each of whom has been with VisionFund for from one to two years. As the leader of the group now applying for a loan, she will use this loan to buy taro seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow more and healthier taros and to earn more income to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy taro seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy, a single man who describes himself as ambitious, has been operating a retail store selling home products such as sugar, salt, blueband, stationery, etc. for five years. With his business located in a busy area, Roy describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods sold. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home products such as sugar, salt, etc., and his goal is to venture into a new business providing vehicle transport services within five years.

loans.use: to buy more home products such as sugar, salt, etc.
