Her business goal is to run a studio within five years.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 45 years old, married and has six children ranging from twelve to thirty two. He describes himself as a determined man. He runs a retail store and sells items such as sugar, milk, bread, airtime, cooking fat etc. He has been in this business for the last three years. His business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the business. He will be using the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar and wheat flour. In the next five years, Patrick hopes and plan to run another retail store in his town area.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Wilfridah

texts.en: Wilfridah is 41 years old, married and has seven children. She is a humble and social woman. She runs a retail shop and sells items such as sugar, tea leaves, salt, cooking fat, milk etc. She has been in this business for the last five years. She also does farming to increase her income. She describes her business challenge to be transportation of goods when buying them. She will be using the KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products to sell. In the future, Wilfridah looks forward to run a bigger retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 42 years old,  a widow and has two children, a sixteen and a twenty-one year old. She describes herself as an innovative, focused and respectful person. For the last twenty years, she has been involved in a butcher shop where she sells meat. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the business. She will be using the KES 50,000 loan to buy more meat for selling. In the next five years, Nancy hopes and dreams of running another butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Reema

texts.en:
Reema is a 29-year-old married woman from Al Baqa'a, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Reema started her business selling cosmetics and accessories years ago from her home. Then, with her hard work and strong determination, she expanded her business into a very well known beauty salon in the area. She has a section for cosmetic products and accessories. Now she is requesting a loan of 900 JD to purchase more quantities of cosmetics and accessories to sell.

Reema is looking to purchase her own home .

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Azingam

texts.en: Azingam is married and has three children ranging from five to thirteen years old. She describes herself as an honest and innocent woman. She runs a grocery store and sells vegetables such as tomatoes, ripe bananas, avocados, onions etc. Her business is in a residential area. She has been in this business for the last five years. She describes her business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. She will be using the KES 15,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. In the next five years, Azingam hopes and dreams of selling all type of vegetables and of venturing into a tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 22-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Hanen is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase materials needed tomake milk nd dairy producrts.

Hannen is looking to to expand her business with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

Due to cultural issues Haneen did not wish to appear in a photo published on the internet, and Haneen's husband appeared in the photo in her place.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to make milk and dairy products

loans.name: Angele

texts.fr:
Angèle habite dans la région du sud sénégal agée de 31 ans ,marée elle a 2 enfants ,un à l'école primaire en classe de 6em le plus petit à 11 mois est avec sa maman.Angèle faisait le commerc de fruits dans le passé ,par la suite dans la zone ou elle habite,il y'a pas un vendeur de boisson fraiche ni de la glace .
Angèle décide d'achéter un frigo neuf pour faire de la glace et vendre de la boissons fraiche ça marche trés bien chez elle , car elle est la seule détanteur d'un frigo dans un quartier.
Angèle décide dans l'avenir faire un n'autre crédit pour acheter un 2em frigo apres avoir soldé ce crédit pour mieux satifaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Angèle, age 31, lives in South Senegal. She's married and has two children. One is in sixth grade, whereas the youngest one is 11 months old and stays with his mother.

In the past, Angèle used to sell fruits. Since there was nobody selling cold drinks or ice in her neighborhood, she decided to purchase a brand new fridge to make ice and sell cold drinks.

This business is very successful since she's the only fridge owner in the neighborhood. In the future, after completing this loan, she would like to get another loan to buy a second fridge, in order to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: La señora Candelaria  cuenta con domicilio propio, ubicado en minero san juan  una zona periurbana de la ciudad Cochabamba, la señora es separada y vive con sus 5 hijos todos ellos estudian en escuela, la señora vende al por mayor los ajos (El ajo, es considerado, uno de los vegetales curativos, más importantes. En los últimos años, se le ha estado dando, mucha más importancia y difusión a este vegetal) tiene clientes ya clientes  fijos  y también vende  en las distintas  ferias, el crédito lo necesita para poder comprar ajo por cantidad por esta época navideña ya que tiene mucha venta. Se dedica al negocio hace 18 años, La Sra. Candelaria es un apersona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan ya que es su única actividad para mantenerse y mantener a sus 5 hijos, el deseo de la Sra. es el ver a todos sus hijos profesionales, por eso se esfuerza y trabaja duro.
texts.en:
Candelaria owns her house located in Minero San Juan in a periurban zone of the city of Cochabamba.  She’s separated and lives with her five children who are all attending school.  She is a garlic wholesaler.  (Garlic is considered to be one of the most important curative vegetables.  In the last few years this vegetable has been getting much more famous and important).  She has regular customers and she also sells at various street markets.  

She needs the loan to buy garlic in quantity because sales increase during the Christmas season.  She’s been in business 18 years.  

Candelaria is a very hardworking person who is happy and grateful to the institution for the support they provide because this is her only source of income to support herself and her five children.  Her wish is to see all her children become professionals and this is why she strives and works hard.

loans.use: to buy garlic in quantity.

loans.name: Villa Granado Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento Villa Granado esta compuesto por ocho integrantes todos viven en la zona de Villa Granado de ahí el nombre para el grupo, esta compuesto por  la siguiente mesa directiva:La presidenta del grupo  es la señora Viviana se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace ya varios años, su familia esta compuesta de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son ya independientes y el menor se encuentra estudiando. El monto que solicito es para comprar  mesas y sillas para ampliar su negocio y brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela que este tiempo aumento por el buen sazón que pone a su comidas y por el trato amable que les brinda, se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado y por la confianza que le brindan.
texts.en: The “Villa Granado” communal bank has 8 members who live in Villa Granado thus the name of the group.  The members of the governing board are: Viviana, President, who has been selling food for several years.  Her family consists of three children two of which are already independent and the youngest is attending school.  The amount she requested is to buy tables and chairs to expand her business and provide more comfort for her customers who have increased in number these days because of the tasty way she prepares her meals and because of the kind treatment she provides them.  She feels happy about the support provided and for the trust placed in her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: El joven Ariel es soltero, tiene 20 años, a pesar de su corta edad tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y buscar un capital propio para su negocio, no tiene hijos, el vive en casa de sus papas en la localidad de sacaba zona central, el  joven  Ariel se dedica a la venta de repuestos de movilidad  todos los días de 08:30 de la mañana a 18:30 de la tarde y se toma un día de descanso que son los días domingos esto para aprovechar y estar con sus hermanos y compartir con su familia,  el préstamo lo invertirá para aumentar su stock de repuesto ya que tiene varios pedidos de talleres de mecánica con quienes trabaja, el Joven Ariel es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que le echa mucho empeño a su trabajo ya que es u única fuente de ingresos para sustentarse.
texts.en:
Ariel, 20, is single.  Despite his young age he very much wants to get a head and seeks capital for his own business.  He does not have children and lives in his parents’ house in Sacaba, Zona Central.  

Young Ariel sells auto spare parts every day from 8:30am until 6:30pm and takes just Sundays off to rest and to spend time with his siblings and his family.  He will use the loan to increases his stock of spare parts since he has several pending orders from repair shops that he works with.  Young Ariel is an enterprising, hardworking person who puts a lot of effort into his work since it’s his only source of income for his support.

loans.use: to increase his stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio, ha sido un padre ejemplar, con su familia, ha logrado, darles un techo digno y seguro. Hoy en dia vive con su esposa y sus hijas estan casadas.
Hara un muro perimetral detrás de su casa, y asi quedar separado del vecino, ya que a ese lado, queda contiguo a su casa.  Lo que desea tener mas privacidad, y seguridad en su terreno. Comprara materiales en piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, piedrin, tablas de madera, y comenzar la construccion.
texts.en: Julio has been an exemplary father with his family; he’s managed to give them a proper, secure roof.  Today, he lives with his wife; his daughters are married.  He will build a perimeter wall behind his house to separate from his neighbor.  He wants to have more privacy and security in his property.  He will buy materials like stone, sand, cement, rebar, gravel, wood boards and will start to build.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Cira

texts.es: La Sra. Cira se dedica  a la venta de ropa vive en la zona del plan 3000 en  casa propia, vive con su hijo, es madre soltera. Es primera vez que solicita un crédito individual ya que anteriormente estaba en el banco de emprendimiento porvenir durante siete ciclos, en el cual demostró buen comportamiento de pago, el crédito que esta solicitando es para aumentar su capital de trabajo ya que por las fiestas de fin de año es donde se vende más ropa y desea comprar mercadería por mayor ropa de temporada. La Sra. Cira, ella sola mantiene su hogar y se encarga de la educación de su hijo que su deseo es un día verlo profesional ya que se esfuerza por darle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
texts.en: Cira sells clothes.  She lives in the Plan 3000 zone in her own house with her son; she’s a single mother.  This is the first time she’s asked for an individual loan since she used to be in the “Porvenir” communal bank for seven cycles and demonstrated good payment behavior.  The loan she’s asking for is to increase working capital because during the end of year festivities more clothing is sold and she wants to buy seasonal merchandise at wholesale.  Cira supports her home alone and she’s responsible for her son’s education and her wish is to see him become professional someday because she strives to give her son a better future.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Wilson Paulino

texts.es: El sr. Wilson es cliente antiguo que retorna después de un descanso en su crédito vive la  zona de Cota Cota, El Sr. Wilson costura edredones los entrega por mayor como también por unidad la mayoría de sus clientes son las mayoristas que venden por la calle Tumusla y las que venden en los locales comerciales,  las entregas los hace semanalmente que oscilan entre dos a tres docenas por semana. El requiere el préstamo para la compra de telas por rollo y fibras por rollo ya que la venta incrementa estas épocas  de fines de año y tiene muchos pedidos que entregar, el Sr. Wilson es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que siempre le brinda la institución ya que gracias a su apoyo creció su negocio.
texts.en:
Wilson is a longstanding client who is returning after taking a break from loans.  He lives in the Cota Cota zone.  He sews comforters that he sells at wholesale and by the unit.  Most of his customers are wholesalers that live around Tumusla Street and that sell them in commercial locales.  He makes his deliveries weekly and he oscillates between two and three dozen per week.

He needs the loan to buy bolts of fabric and filler because sales increase during the end of year and he has many pending orders to fill.  Wilson is a very hardworking person who feels happy and grateful for the opportunity the institution always provides since thanks to its support his business grew.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Gabriel Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Gabriel se dedica  al confección de ropa deportiva, es su  primer crédito dentro la institución, fue invitado por su hermana,  trabaja en el área de producción de deportivos hace ya dos años, vive en casa familiar con sus hermanos y dos de sus hijos  jóvenes su taller se encuentra en la misma casa y en algunos momentos realiza contrato con colegios y otras instituciones  a quienes entrega por cantidad, con el dinero del crédito comprar telas e hilos para la confección de prendas deportivas,   una de sus metas  es comprar su casa para poder irse con sus hijos y poder independizarse y así también brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, el Sr Gabriel, es una persona muy trabajadora, con el tiempo desea ofrecer sus productos en la ciudades de Cochabamba y Oruro, se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Gabriel manufactures sportswear.  This is his first loan from the institution.  His sister invited him.  He’s been working making sportswear for two years now.  He lives in the family home with his siblings and two of his young children.  His workshop is located at home and occasionally he negotiates contracts with schools and other institutions to which he sells in quantity.  

Money from the loan will be used to buy fabric and thread to make the sportswear.  One of his goals is to buy a house so that he can go there with his children and become independent while providing more comfort for his family at the same time.  

Gabriel is a very hardworking person.  In time, he’d like to sell his products in the cities of Cochabamba and Oruro.  He feels very grateful for the opportunity he’s being given.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La señora María cuenta con dos actividades la actividad  principal es la venta de comida ella realiza esta actividad desde horas. 17:00 a 21:00, ella vive con sus hermanos mayores trabaja para costear sus costos propios ella no cuenta con familia ( esposo e hijos) es soltera su segunda actividad es la costura tiene su maquina propia y trabaja de acuerdo a la época ejemplo en inicio de clases realiza uniforme de faldas escolares tiene muchas ganas de superación para mas adelante ya que desea tener su propio taller d costura y poder emplear mano de obra, vive en casa familiar en la zona de Santiago en el alto, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de tela ya que pronto iniciaran las labores escolares y ella realizar uniformes escolares.
texts.en: Maria has two businesses:the main one is selling food between 5 and 9 pm.  She lives with her older siblings and works to cover her own expenses.  She doesn’t have a family (husband and children)-she is single.  Her second business is sewing.  She has her own sewing machine and she works according to the season.  For example, when classes start, she makes skirts for school uniforms.  She has great hopes of having her own sewing shop in the future and to be able to employ assistants.  She lives in a family house in Santiago in El Alto.  She will use the money from the loan to buy fabric since school sessions will start and she will make the uniforms.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 76 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos.

Él se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, fueron sus padres y otros familiares que le enseñaron este trabajo. Su especialidad es sembrar maíz y maicillo, todos los días se levanta a las 3:30 a.m. a darle de comer a sus vacas y ha ordeñarlas, luego se va al campo a trabajar, ya sea a tapiscar o a limpiar su milpa durante ocho horas.

El señor José solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar una yunta de bueyes (2 bueyes), para trasportar su cosecha desde el lugar donde la tiene sembrada hasta su casa que son aproximadamente cuatro kilómetros, ya que le cobran mucho dinero por este servicio, de esta manera él se ahorrara ese pago y al mismo tiempo prestara sus servios a otras personas que lo soliciten. De esta manera don José desea brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, 76, is married and has 2 children.

He has been a farmer since he was very young; his parents and other relatives taught him how to do this type of work.  He specializes in growing corn and sorghum.  He gets up every day at 3:30am to feed his cows and milk them.  Later on he goes to the countryside to work for 8 hours, either to harvest or to clear his cornfields.

Jose is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a pair of oxen to transport his harvest from the place where he grows the crops to his house, which is a distance of about 4 kilometers, since they charge a lot of money for this service.  Thus, he will be able to save money, and he can also lend out his oxen to other people who need them.  In this way, Jose hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen

loans.name: Nataly Lizeth

texts.es: La señora Nataly  vive en casa de sus padres y cuenta con negocio fijo, pero esta caseta es en alquiler, vende  gorras viceras, para este fin de año esta comprando gorras ya que hay bastante demanda de este producto, por tal motivo solicito el crédito, cuenta con su propia mercadería y capital, con el tiempo desea comprarse el puesto don de vende, vive en una zona periurbana de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es una persona joven con ganas de superación, trabaja mucho ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite solventar a su familia, que a pesar de su corta edad se hace cargo de algunos gastos de la casa, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Nataly lives in her parent's house, and has a regular business in a rented stall where she sells hats with visors.  For the end of this year she is buying caps, because there is a lot of demand for this product.  This is the reason that she is requesting a loan.  She has her own merchandise and capital, and in time she wants to buy the stall where she sells her products.  She lives in an urban neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Cochabamba.  She is a young person who has a strong desire to succeed.  She works a lot and this is the only activity that allows her to pay bills for her family, because in spite of her young age, she is responsible for some of the household expenses.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that is being provided to her.

loans.use: to buy caps in bulk

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: La señora Yadira  se dedica  a la venta y elaboración de pan y salteñas, esta casada con el  señor Olvis,  actualmente  están viviendo por la zona del plan 3000,  Sra.  Yadira se dedica ya hace 2 años a esta actividad,  solo los fines de semana a la producción y venta de pan casero y los demás días a la venta de salteñas, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Yadira comprara una heladera,  su cónyuge se dedica como chofer de taxi, el vehículo que conduce no es de su propiedad el entrega renta diaria. Los solicitante son personas amables y muy responsables, los solicitantes agradecieron por el apoyo, y la rapidez en la otorgación del préstamo, La Sra. Yadira trabaja duro y fuerte es una persona con ganas de superación desea mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Yadora bakes and sells bread and meat pies. She is married to Olvis. At present, they live in the Plan 3000 zone. Yadira has devoted herself to this activity for some 2 years now. On weekends she bake regular bread, then on the remaining days of the week, she sells meat pies. With funds from the loan Yadira will buy a refrigerator. Her husband drives a taxi, which is not his property; he must rent it daily.

They are sincere and responsible people, and they're grateful for the help. Yadira works hard with much effort. She has a strong urge to get ahead and desires a better quality of life for her and all her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her baking business.

loans.name: Santos Valentin

texts.es:
Don Santos es originario de Telica municipio de León, es  casado, tiene 2 hijos. El es comerciante tiene una vulcanización y también  es dueño de  una barbería. El comenzó a trabajar desde muy joven el recuerda que su primer negocio fue reparación de bicicletas   después aprendió el oficio de la barbería  y de ultimo adquirió experiencia en un taller de vulcanización.   
El realizo el crédito para comprar repuestos de bicicletas y artículos para la barbería. Pues son herramientas y artículos muy necesarios para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio. 
Una de sus expectativas poner un taller de reparación de zapatos  y brindándole servicios de mucha utilidad y necesidad en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos is from Telica in the municipality of León. He is married and has two children. He is a businessman with a tire repair shop. He is also the owner of a barber shop. He began working when he was very young. He remembers that his first business was in bicycle repairs. Later he learned the barber business and most recently he has acquired experience in a tire repair shop.

He requested this loan to purchase bicycle parts and items for a barber shop. These are very necessary tools and items for the functioning of his business. 

One of his hopes is to start his own shoe repair shop and offer much needed and useful services to his community.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts and items for a barber shop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, una  señora de 55 años de edad, humilde, sencilla , trabajadora, que se gana la vida haciendo pan no en hornos comunes ni muchos menos modernos sino es aquellos hornos hecho de barro y teja  propios y comunes del municipio de Telica en las afueras de León donde aun los horno eléctrico no son muy conocidos. Levantándose  desde muy tempranas horas dela  madrugada con sus sencillas manos dándole forma al pan caliente que se come cada día la gente es que mujeres como doña Juana mantuvo a sus hijos y hogar.  Ella junto con su esposo e hijos han luchado por sobrevivir con este negocio. El cual ella empezó cuando tenia 24 años de edad, sus padres fueron los primeros que empezaron con la panadería luego ella se fue haciendo cargo y lo ha administrado hasta el día de hoy.
Ella solicita el crédito para compra de harina, azúcar, aceite, levadura, ya que es parte de la materia prima que utiliza para realizar su sabroso pan matutino. Una de sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio  e ir mejorando la calidad para obtener buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana is a 55-year-old woman who is modest, unassuming, and hard working.  She earns a living making bread in ovens that are neither ordinary nor modern, but are instead made of clay and tile; such ovens are typical and common in the town of Telica, on the outskirts of León, where electric ovens are not very well known.  Juan gets up very early in the morning and with her modest hands creates the hot bread that the people eat every day.  That is how women like Juana maintain their children and their home.  She and her husband and children have struggled to survive with this business.  She started out in the business when she was 24 years old; her parents were the ones who started the bakery, and she soon took charge and has managed the bakery ever since.

Juana is asking for a loan in order to purchase flour, sugar, oil, and yeast, since these are some of the ingredients she uses to make her delicious morning bread.  She expects that this will increase her business and improve the quality so she can earn a good income.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, oil, and yeast.

loans.name: Andres 		Heliodoro

texts.es:
Don Andrés, de 58 años de edad, es originario de León , es padre de 7 hijos , el es comerciante , vende leche y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdo. Su nivel escolar es básico solo finalizo su sexto grado de la primaria. Aunque su experiencia en la agricultura la obtuvo desde muy joven cuando se iba a trabajar junto con sus  padres al campo. Hoy en día sus negocios solo son la crianza de cerdo y venta de leche. 
El realizo el crédito para compra de cerdos de desarrollo. Ya que le gustaría tener un granja de cerdos reproductores de raza y especializarse en su crianza para tenerlo en optimas condiciones y hacer su negocio mas sostenible. Pues su objetivo es darle un mejor nivel de  vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Don andrés, 58, is from León and is the father of seven children.  He works as a merchant selling milk, and also raises pigs.  His education went only as far as the sixth grade but he has much experience in agriculture since he began working with his parents in the fields when he was very young.  Now he earns a living raising pigs and selling milk.

He is requesting a loan to buy pigs and use them to produce breeds on a farm.  He wants to specialize in this type of breeding under optimum conditions and make his business sustainable.  His goal is to give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Socias En Progreso (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los 2 socios y las 11 socias  del Grupo De  Crédito Socias En Progreso. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios, etc. Ellos hace poco y al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  para  poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir recibiendo los créditos.

Una de socias de este grupo es la señora Jacqueline, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y la menor estudia en universidad. El marido es comerciante.

Ella aprendió corte y confección hace varios años en una academia de la ciudad, tiene un taller de costura en su casa en el cual confecciona todo tipo de prendas, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00, dependiendo de los pedidos que tenga que entregar, con ella trabaja una señora a quien le paga un sueldo mensual, nos cuenta que a veces ella  confecciona ropa a instituciones y colegios de la localidad, pero también a personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller, lleva más de 18 años dedicada en esta actividad y nos dice que lo que más le gusta hacer es ropa de niñas y de damas.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Este es su primer crédito en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es salir adelante en  su negocio.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de dos socias que por motivos personales no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the San Cristóbal community of the city of Portoviejo, the 13 members of the communal bank "Socias en Progreso" meet every two weeks.  They are involved in different business activities such as general commerce, services, etc.  Recently, on becoming aware of the benefits offered by the institution, they decided to request a loan through Fundación Espoir.  This is their first cycle in the communal bank and they are committed to complying with the terms so they can receive future loans.

One of the members of the group is Mrs. Jacqueline, who is 38, married and has three adult children, two of which still live at home.  The youngest studies at the university.  Her husband is a merchant.

She learned her sewing skills several years ago at an academy in the city.  She has a sewing workshop set up in her house and makes all kinds of clothing.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m., depending on the orders she must deliver, and has an employee on a monthly salary.  She tells us that sometimes she sews for institutions and schools in the area, and also for people who come to her shop.  She has been in business for over 18 years and says she enjoys making girls and women's clothing.

This loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.  This is her first loan with the communal bank and she likes the fact that the loans can be obtained so quickly.

Her dream is for her business to thrive.  

The two small pictures are of the members who, for personal reasons, could not be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Monserrate (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace tres ciclos y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

Uno de los socios de este grupo es el señor Carlos, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro mayores y el menor de 17 años de edad el cual estudia en colegio, todos sus hijos viven en su casa.  Su esposa es ama de casa.

El trabaja en una empresa en la ciudad de Manta, pero además de esto es comerciante,  en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y edredones, nos cuenta que por las noches se va a visitar a sus clientes para venderles sus productos, les deja a crédito y cobra en dos partes, los cobros los realiza los fines de semana, su mercadería compra en Guayaquil  cuando necesita. Lleva dedicado a esta labor  6 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños, sabanas y e dredones. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.

Su sueño es comprar un carro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Monserrate" meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts that are renowned both nationally and internationally.  It is the place of the famous Panama straw hat.

This group of people decided to get together three cycles ago and set up the communal bank which has helped them greatly.  With the loans they have received they have improved their small business and lifestyles.  They are involved in different businesses such as agriculture, general commerce, services and other activities.  

One of the members of the group is Mr. Carlos, 48, who is married and has five children, four adults and a minor son who is 17 and in school.  All of his children live at home.  His wife is a homemaker.

He works for a compny in the city of Manta, but is also a merchant and in his free time sells all kinds of clothing, sheets and comforters.  In the evenings he goes out to visit his customers to sell his products which he leaves on credit and then collects in two payments.  He collects payment on the weekends.  He buys merchandise in Guayaquil when necessary.  He has been in business for six years and it is going well for him.  

This loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, sheets and comforters.  This is his third cycle with the communal bank and he enjoys the benefits offered by the institution.

His dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Union Trabajo Y Desarrollo (Rocafuerte) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión Trabajo y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en un la ciudad de  Rocafuerte perteneciente a la Provincia de Manabí, lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
Este es un grupo de 14 socias y 1 socio que decidieron unirse hace tiempo atrás  y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida en general. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio, servicios, entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Carolina, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 1 años, el mayor estudian en escuela. El marido es operador de una máquina retroexcavadora.

Ella en sociedad con su mamá tienen un restaurante en la localidad, trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 y hasta las 19h00,  preparan desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas, nos cuenta que hasta su local día a día llegan muchos clientes a servirse sus deliciosos platos, nos dice que el plato que más le piden sus clientes es el viche de camarón y pescado que es un plato típico de nuestra provincia y muy apetecido, llevan en este negocio por más de 5 años y les va muy bien ya que tienen muchos clientes que las prefieren por su sazón.
 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Unión Trabajo y Desarrollo" meets every two weeks in the city of Rocafuerte which belongs to the province of Manabí.  This place is known for its wide variety of sweets that are famous nationally for their delicious flavor.  The group is comprised of 14 women and one man who decided to get together to set up the communal bank.  It has been of great help to them since their loans have improved their small businesses and lives in general.  They are involved in different business activities such as agriculture, commerce, services and other activities.

One of the members of the group is Mrs. Carolina, 28, who has a common-law husband and two children, ages 7 and 1.  The eldest is in school.  Her husband is a retro-excavating machine operator.

Together with her mother she runs a restaurant in the city and works every day from 5:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  She serves breakfast, lunch and afternoon snacks.  She says she has many customers wanting to taste her delicious dishes every day, the most popular of which is her shrimp and fish viche which is the typical dish of the province and very appetizing.  She has been in business for over five years and it is going very well because of the many customers who prefer her cuisine.

This loan will be used to buy food ingredients.  She has been in the communal bank since its inception and is the president.  She likes how quick it is to obtain a loan.

Her goals are to continue getting ahead in her business and to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Las Teresitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Teresitas está conformado por las señoras Silvina, Alejandra, Eufemia Maclovia van a comprar con su préstamo maíz, verduras, tortillas, longaniza, requesón, condimentos para elaborar pozole, tostadas y tacos dorados, las señoras Rosa Isela, Agustina, Adelina van a comprar leña y maíz, la señora Lourdes va a comprar pollo vivo para vender por pieza, por kilo o entero, la señora Gabriela va a comprar pan, mayonesa, verduras, refrescos, para la elaboración de tortas, la señora Dora Dina va a comprar carne, cilantro, cebolla, tortillas, aceite,  limón para elaborar taquitos, la señora María Lehurdes Dalia va a comprar tomates, chiles, jitomates, cebolla, lechuga para la venta, las señoras Maricela y Heriberta van a comprar refrescos, la señora Maribel va a comprar masa, verduras, carnes para elaborar picadas y dobladas, la señora Verónica va a comprar barro, tule, arena, leña, pintura para elaborar comales. La señora Agustina tiene 42 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, ella tiene 4 hijos 2 mujeres y 2 varones, ella vende leña y maíz, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar leña y maíz para vender, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años por necesidad como sus hijos estan pequeños y están estudiando, su hijo el mayor le ayuda en su negocio le trae del campo la leña, su negocio es importante porque va obteniendo ingresos para sus hijos que están en la escuela, ella está orgullosa de tener su propio negocio como esta en su casa pude estar haciendo su quehacer, atender a sus hijos  y atender a sus clientas que son las muchachas y las señoras amas de casa, ella utiliza las ganancias para volver a invertir compra mas maíz. Sus sueños y esperanza son ver crecer a sus hijos que a sus hijos no les falte nada que tengan todo. Ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir porque va a comprar maíz  Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por prestarnos, por el apoyo es una gran ayuda y ojala nos sigan prestando”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Las Teresitas".  Its members Silvina, Alejandra, and Eufemia Maclovia are going to use the loan to buy corn, vegetables, tortillas, sausage, cottage cheese, pozole condiments, tostadas and golden tacos.  Rosa Isela, Agustina and Adelina are going to buy firewood and corn.  Lourdes plans to buy chicken that she will sell by the kilo or whole.  Gabriela will buy bread, mayonnaise, vegetables, softdrinks, and cake ingredients.  Dora Dina plans to buy meat, coriander, onion, tortillas, oil, and lemon to make taquitos.  María Lehurdes Dalia will buy tomatoes, chili peppers, onion, and lettuce to sell.  Maricela and Heriberta will buy softdrinks.  Maribel plans to buy pastry dough, vegetables, and meat to make "picadas" and "dobladas".  Veronica will buy clay, tulle, sand, firewood and paint to make comales (earthenware pan).  

Mrs. Agustina is 42 and a single mother of four children, two girls and two boys.  She is requesting a loan to buy firewood and corn to sell.  She began business two years ago due to necessity because her children are young and in school.  Her eldest son helps her with the business and brings the firewood from the countryside.  Her business is important because she is able to make enough money to support her children.  She is proud of having her own business such as this in her home where she can attend to her chores and watch the children, while also attending to her customers who are young women and housewives.  She uses her earnings to invest in buying more corn.  Her hopes and dreams are for her children to grow up having everything they need.  She is grateful for the loan she will use to buy corn.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for the loans and support which are of great help, and hopefully we can receive mroe loans.".

loans.use: To buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es: El señor Amado es integrante del grupo, el va a comprar con su prestamo pan, mayonesa, carnes frias para preparar tortas, las otras integrantes siguen en su actividad que vienen desempeñando. La señora Delia tiene 28 años de edad, ella es soltera no tiene hijos, ella tiene una tienda de ropa, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar blusas, pantalones, pans, faldas, ropa de bebe, ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años, la necesidad la hizo emprender su negocio, compro la mercancía con los ahorros de su trabajo anterior, su negocio es ambulante vende sus productos en el mercado de su comunidad, su negocio es importante porque de ahí se mantiene puede cubrir sus gastos, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio y se alegra cuando sus ventas son buenas, ella invierta las ganancia comprando mas ropa para tener surtido su puesto, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio meter zapatos de dama y caballero y lo piensa lograr con los prestamos. Sus sueños y esperanza son tener bien surtido su negocio para dar mejor servicio al cliente. Los integrantes del grupo  les quieren decir a Kiva y a fundación realidad “Les agradecemos su apoyo,  gracias por prestarnos para salir adelante en los negocios, por confiar en nosotros”.
texts.en:
Amado is a member of the group.  He will use his loan to buy bread, mayonnaise, and cold cuts to make sandwiches.  The other members of the group continue with their business activities.

Delia, age 28, is single and does not have children.  She has a clothing store.  She requested the loan to buy blouses, pants, skirts, and baby clothes.  She started her business five years ago.  She undertook her business due to necessity.  She bought the merchandise with the savings from her previous work.  She sells her products in an itinerant manner at the market in her community.  Her business is important because that is how she supports herself and is able to cover her expenses.

She is proud to have her own business, and she is glad when her sales are good.  She invests her earnings in the purchase of more clothes in order to keep her business stocked.  She is planning on expanding her business and adding women’s and men’s shoes.  She plans to do so with the loans.

Her hopes and dreams are for her business to be well-stocked in order to give her customers better service.  The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “We are grateful for your support.  Thanks for lending to us and trusting us so that we can get ahead in our businesses.”

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, skirts, and baby clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fomi, silicon, ribbon, scissors, and eyes.

loans.name: Vilma Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Vilma es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive en una comunidad en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
Doña Vilma tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, está feliz ya que se encuentra embarazada de de 8 meses. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción ya que es albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Vilma pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos y también se dedica a la agricultura, lo que cosecha es para su consumo y para la venta. Cría  y vende pollos, borregos y chanchos.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón para pollos.

Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the communal bank Nuevo Bankito la Ramada. She lives in a community in Cuenca. This place has a cold climate. Her people raise animals, are farmers, and many work in the city at many activities. Her people retain the culture and traditions of their communities.
Vilma is 24 years old, is married, and in their conjugal union has conceived two children of five and two years old. Her first child is in a small school in the city. She is happy because she is eight months pregnant. Her husband works in the area of construction since he is a bricklayer. The house in which they live is their property.
Vilma cares for the children at home and she is engaged in agriculture.  The harvest is for her own consumption and to sell. She raises and sells chickens, sheep, and pigs.
She is currently in her fourth loan with the communal bank and she is going to invest it in the construction of a chicken coop.
Her goal is to improve her home.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive en una comunidad  en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. María tiene 30 años,  es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad y un bebé de 10 meses. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos se queda en casa y se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas que son para la venta y  para el consumo de su hogar, también cría y vende pollos, cuyes y credos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en  alimento para animales. 

Su meta es ampliar su negocio de pollos. 

En la foto esta la socia con su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Nuevo Bankito la Ramada. She lives in a community in Cuenca. This place has a cold climate. Her people are dedicated to animal husbandry, agriculture, and many work in the city at different activities. Her people retain the culture and tradition of their communities.
Maria is 30 years old, is married and in their conjugal union has conceived three children of four and three years old and a baby of ten months. Her husband works in agriculture. The house in which they live is their property.
Maria, to spend more time with her children, stays at home and works in agriculture. She plants vegetables for sale and for consumption in her home. She also raises and sells chickens, guinea pigs, and creeds.
In the communal bank, she is in her third loan. She is going to invest it in the purchase of chickens and animal feed.
Her goal is to expand her chicken business.
In the photograph is the member with her son.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Las Malinches Group

texts.es: La señora Genoveva tiene 48 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre, ella tiene 4 hijos 2 varones y 2 mujeres, dos de sus hijos están estudiando una joven en el CBTA y un varón en la primaria, ella vende fruta de temporada aguacate, durazno, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar planta de durazno y abono para cultivar las plantas, ella inicio su negocio hace un año, es herencia de su suegro, su esposo le enseño a cultivar las plantas y con un préstamo  compraron las plantas. Su negocio es importante porque saca para el pago, para la alimentación y para seguir trabajando, ella vende su mercancia en la plaza y en el mercado de su comunidad sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su negocio, la ganancia las utiliza para compras plantas, bolsas y abono. Sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir trabajando, tener más plantas y apoyar a sus hijos pequeños a seguir estudiando. las integrantes de grupo le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad por sus prestamos, por confiar en nosotros y por ayudarnos a segurir trabajando en los negocios."
texts.en:
Genoveva is 48 years old, has a partner and 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls.  Two of her children are studying in the CBTA and one boy is in primary school.  She sells seasonal fruit such as avocadoes and peaches.  She requested her loan to buy peach plants and fertilizer for her crops.  She started her business, an inheritance from her father-in-law, one year ago.  Her husband taught her how to cultivate the plants, which they bought with a loan.

Her business is important because it generates funds for food and to continue working.  She sells her products in the plaza and at her community’s market.  Her children and husband assist her with her business.  She uses her earnings to buy plants, bags and fertilizer.  Her dreams and hopes are to continue working, to have more plants, and to support her small children in continuing their educations.  

The members of the group “thank Kiva and Fundacion Realidad for their loans, for having confidence in them, and for helping them to continue working in their businesses”.

loans.use: buy peach plants, fertilizer, and seasonal fruits such as peaches and avocados.

loans.name: María Celia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive en una comunidad en Cuenca, este  lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Doña María tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 5 de sus hijos viven independientes ya que son casados, sus cuatro hijos solteros se encuentran de 16, 13, 11 y 8 años de edad, uno de sus hijos estudia en el colegio y trabaja, sus tres últimos hijos se encuentran estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción ya que es albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 

La Señora María se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y verduras, las cuales son para la venta y es para el consumo de su hogar, también cría y vende gallinas, cuyes y cerdos, esta actividad le permite pasar en casa y cuidar de su familia.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes, cerdos y en alimento para animales.

 Su meta es seguir creciendo en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Nuevo Bankito la Ramada cooperative bank.  She lives in a community in Cuenca, an area with a cold climate.  Her people dedicate themselves to raising animals and farming, and many work in the city doing various activities.  Her people maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

María is 51 years old, married, and, in this union, bore 9 children.  Five of her children live independently, since they are now married.  Her four single children are ages 16, 13, 11 and 8.  One of her children is in school and works, and her three youngest children are students in the city’s little school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  The house in which they live is their own property.

María dedicates herself to the farming of vegetables, which she both sells and uses for her own family’s consumption.  She also raises and sells chickens, guinea pigs and hogs.  This activity allows her to stay at home and tend to her family.

She finds herself in her third loan with the cooperative bank, and plans to invest it in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs, hogs, and feed for the animals.

Her goal is to continue growing her business of raising animals.

loans.use: buy chickens, guinea pigs, hogs, and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
Edilberta cuenta con 25 años de edad, vive unión libre con su pareja tienen 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando la primaria el mayor esta en 4° de primaria se llama víctor Javier y Lizeth esta en 3° su esposo se llama víctor es campesino.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende frutas y verduras ya tiene 4 años con el negocio sale a vender en su pueblo y también tiene establecido un lugar en su casa, dice que le va muy bien ya que invertirá su préstamo en la compra de verduras y frutas como son: manzana, naranjas, lechuga, jitomate, chile, etc. Ella espera que le vaya muy bien en el negocio y así poder incrementarlo mas ya que le gustaría poner otro negocio.

Edilberta pertenece al grupo azucenas el cual esta integrado por 11 personas las cuales todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas: Alberta, Demetria, Lorenza, Junvencia, Susana, Delfina, Alejandra, Aureliana, Constancia, Roxana, todas realizan una actividad comercial como venta de ropa, pan, refrescos, tamales, frutas y verduras, etc.
texts.en:
Edilberta is 25 years old and lives with her partner; they have 2 children who are in primary school.  The older child, Víctor Javier, is in 4th grade, and Lizbeth is in 3rd grade.  Her husband is named Víctor and is an agricultural worker.

She dedicates herself to commerce, selling fruits and vegetables.  She has 4 years in the business, and goes out to sell in her town and also has a site in her house.  She states that things are going well, and she will invest her loan into the purchase of fruits and vegetables such as:  apples, oranges, lettuce, tomatoes, chilies, etc.  She hopes that things go very well for her with the business so she can expand it more, and she would also like to open another business.

Edilberta belongs to the group Azucenas (Lilies), which is comprised of 11 members who are all hard-working women.  We will mention them here:  Alberta, Demetria, Lorenza, Junvencia, Susana, Delfina, Alejandra, Aureliana, Constancia and Roxana.  They all carry out some type of commercial activity such as the sale of clothing, bread, beverages, tamales, fruits and vegetables, etc.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables such as:  apples, oranges, lettuce, tomatoes, chilies, etc.

loans.name: Santa Catarina Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Santa Catarina  ,esta formado por once mujeres indígenas que hablan el idioma  mixteco ,son personar orgullosas de su trabajo y de su  pequeña comunidad.
La representante de este grupo es la señora Raquel de  veinte cinco años de edad ,una persona trabajadora ,honesta con deseos de superarse cada día y ayudar a su familia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años ya que su negocio le deja buenas ganancias y así puede tener un dinero extra.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Gerardo quien se dedica a la siembra de maíz desde hace siete años.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos: Luz Violeta de siete años de edad que cursa segundo año de la escuela primaria , Juan Gerardo de cuatro años de edad que cursa  segundo año del Kinder  y Rosa Cristina de  tres año de edad que cursa primer año de Kinder.
Ella nos cuenta que  pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa juvenil como son: pantalones, faldas  blusas  y playeras.
 Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Cecilia-que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Leticia-que se dedica a la venta de ropa artesanal.
Tomasa –que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Cristina-que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Teresa-que se dedica ala venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Rogelia-que se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Claudia-que se dedica a la venta de bordados de prendas artesanales.
Felicitas-que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Margarita-que se dedica a la venta de leche.
Epifania Irene-que se dedica a la venta de antojitos  mexicanos.

Le dan las gracias por ayudar ala gente mixteca con deseos de darle una mejor vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
This group is called Santa Catarina. It is made up of eleven indigenous women who speak the Mixteco language. They are proud of their jobs and their small community.   

The group representative is Raquel, who is twenty-five. She is a hardworking, honest person, who wants to get ahead every day and help her family. She has worked selling clothes for three years and her business gives her good earnings so she can have extra money. She is happily married to Gerardo who has worked planting corn for seven years. She has three children: Luz Violeta, who is seven and in the second grade. Juan Gerardo is four and in the second year of pre-school, and Rosa Cristina is three and in the first year of pre-school.  

She tells us that she asked for the loan to buy more young peoples' clothing such as pants, skirts, blouses and t-shirts. 

The other members are: 
Cecilia-she sells Mexican snacks. 
Leticia-she sells artisanal clothing. 
Tomasa –she sells Mexican snacks. 
Cristina-she sells Mexican snacks.
Teresa-she sells Mexican snacks..
Rogelia-she sells clothes.
Claudia-she sells artisanal embroidered clothes. 
Felicitas-she sells Mexican snacks.
Margarita-she sells milk.
Epifania Irene-she sells Mexican snacks..

They are thankful for the help people have given to the Mixteca people who want to give a better life to their families.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Erika Tatiana

texts.es:
La Señora Erika es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, es muy rica en su cultura, su gente es muy amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. Erika tiene 20 años de edad, vive en unión libre y en su unión han concebido 2 hijos de 3 años y un bebé 11 meses de edad. Su esposo es empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá y comparten los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Erika por el momento se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos que están pequeñitos, este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  al cual fue invitada por su mamá, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para iniciar con la venta de estos productos.
 
Su meta iniciar con el negocio de venta de cosméticos y llegar a tener un local para vender estos productos.
texts.en:
Erika is a member of the Loma de la Cruz communal bank and she lives in the city of Cuenca. This city has great architectural beauty and a rich culture. Its people are friendly and they keep their culture and traditions. 
 
Erika is 20 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has 2 children, a 3 year old and an 11 month old baby. Her husband is a private employee. She doesn't own her own home, so she lives in her mother's home and shares the expenses. 
 
Erika is at this time taking care of her children who are small. This is her first loan in the communal bank, to which she was invited by her mother. She is going to invest the loan in buying cosmetics to start selling these products.   
 
Her goal is to start this business selling cosmetics and to have a locale to sell them.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, es muy rica en su cultura, su gente es muy amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
Doña María tiene 27 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una niña de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora en una carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de periódicos, revistas y billetes de lotería, esta actividad la realiza hace 10 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de revistas, periódicos y billetes de lotería para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
27-year-old Maria is a member of the community bank 'Loma de la Cruz' and lives in the city of Cuenca. The city is rich in culture with beautiful architecture, and it's people are very friendly and strive to maintain their culture and traditions.
 
María is married, with a 3-year-old child. Her husband is a carpenter, and they are currently renting their home as they do not not have their own.

María sells newspapers, magazines and lottery tickets. She has had this business for 10 years and works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.
 
This is María's fourth loan cycle with her community bank. She will invest the money in the purchase of magazines, newspapers and lottery tickets to continue with her business.
 
María's goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase magazines, newspapers and lottery tickets for her business.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, es muy rica en su cultura, su gente es muy amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. María tiene 47 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña María es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de periódico, revistas y billetes de lotería, esta actividad la realiza hace 30 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de periódicos, revistas y billetes de lotería para su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
47-year-old María is a member of the communal bank 'Loma de la Cruz' and lives in the city of Cuenca. The city is rich in culture with beautiful architecture, and it's people are very friendly and strive to maintain their culture and traditions.
 
María lives with her partner, with whom she has had 3 children who are now grown, married and living independently. Her husband is a trader, and they are renting their house as they do not own their own home. 

María is a merchant and sells newspapers, magazines and lottery tickets. She has had this business for 30 years and works from Sunday to Sunday, 6 am to 6 pm.
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years and will invest this new loan in the purchase of newspapers, magazines and lottery tickets for her business.
 
María's goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: purchase of newspapers, magazines and lottery tickets for her business.

loans.name: Vuochteang's Group

texts.en:
Vuochteang is fifty-six years old, married and lives in a village of the Sa Ang district of Cambodia. She has four children, one of whom works at a garment factory.

Vuochteang has been earning a living by growing and selling taro for the past twenty years. She currently earns less than 4 USD each day to feed her family.

Vuochteang has been with VisionFund for two years, and she has successfully paid back her loans with them. Now she leads a group of three members who are applying for a 2,800,000 KHR loan.

With her portion of the loan, Vuochteang wants to buy taro seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow more taro to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy taro seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal is 46 years old, widowed and has three children, one of whom works at a garment factory. She has struggled to feed her children by growing taro to sell. She supplements her income by making cakes to sell in the village.

Sophal received a loan from VisionFund three years ago, and she successfully paid back her last loan with them. Her past loans, taken beginning in 2008, have helped make her living significantly better.

Sophal now leads a group of three members who have been with VisionFund for two to three years. Business being good, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR with her group members to buy more ingredients such as rice, coconut, soybean etc. for her cake-making business.

Sophal hopes to sell more cakes to her villagers to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her cake-making business.

loans.name: Tob's Group

texts.en:
A villager of the Sa And district, Tob is 29 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is in school.

Tob is a rice farmer who has been farming her own farmland for eighteen years. She buys and sells fish in the village to supplement her income. She now earns 10 USD each day from her work.

This is Tob’s group’s first loan with VisionFund. She leads this group of three members in applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR with the lender. As the leader of the group, she wants to buy more fish to resell.

Tob hopes this loan will enable her to grow her fish-selling business and make her life better.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
The mother of a big family of ten children, Sokly is 48 years old now. She is a farmer who has been growing rice to sell to support her family. To better feed her family, she also raises pigs in her backyard to supplement her income. She has been in this business for ten years.

Sokly and her group member, Vanna, are applying for their first loan with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she plans to use her portion of this 400 USD loan to buy pig feed and a piglet.

This loan will enable Sokly to raise a fat and healthy pig. She hopes to earn more money by doing so.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and a piglet.

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Sa Ang district, Leap is 31 years and married. She has no children yet.

Leap is a farmer who grows rice, taro, ginger and beans as her main source of income. She has been farming for ten years.

Leap has been with VisionFund since 2010, and she successfully paid back her previous loan with them. She and her two group members who joined VisionFund in the last two years are applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR with VFC.

As the leader of the group, Leap will use this loan to buy fertilizer and taro seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to increase her yields and so improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and taro seedlings for her farmland.

loans.name: Vicheka's Group

texts.en:
Vicheka is thirty years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She lives in a village stretching alongside a river where growing vegetables is common as a main source of income.

Like the other villagers, Vicheka also grows vegetables such as cucumbers and sells fish to make a living. She now earns around 11 USD each day to feed her family and pay for her son's education.

Vicheka and her group member, Heang, are applying for an initial 500 USD loan from VisionFund. She wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and more fish to resell.

Vicheka hopes to grow her business and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and more fish to resell.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
A citizen of a village located in the Sa And district of Cambodia, Sarom is forty years old and has six children, a few of whom are still in school. She is a farmer who has been growing rice for thirty years.

Sarom leads a group of three female members. This is her first loan with VisionFund, while her group members have been with VisionFund for the last two years. The group is requesting a 3,000,000 KHR loan with VFC.

With her portion of the loan, Sarom wants to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and generate a good yield so as to increase her family’s income.

Sarom wishes to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is forty, married and has three children. She lives in a village in the Sa Ang district of Cambodia.

Srey is a farmer who has grown rice for nearly twenty years. She has been with VisionFund for two years and has successfully paid back her loans. The loans have helped her create a better life. Her group of two members is now applying for a 2,000,000 KHR loan with VFC.

As the leader of the group, Srey plans to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and so increase its yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Srun's Group

texts.en:
Srun who is 49 years old and married is the breadwinner of a big family with ten children in a village of the Sa Ang district of Cambodia. She and her husband have struggled to earn income to feed their big family by growing vegetables as their only source of income. They have been in this business for 24 years. 

Srun has been with VisionFund since 2009 and the loans from the past two years have helped her feed her family regularly. With good businesses, Srun and the other three group members, who have just joined and who have been with VisionFund for from one to five years, are applying for a loan. As the leader of the group, Srun will use the entire loan of US$250 to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her grow vegetables successfully and also increase her welfare.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is fifty years old and is originally from a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district where crop farming is common to support a living. She is a widowed mother of three dependent children who all are still in school. Planting maize is the main income source for the family and she sometimes works for others for pay to better support her live as a widow. She has been in this business for nearly four decades. 

Pov has been with VisionFund since 2008. The loans from the previous four years have helped her make a better living. Now she leads a group of three female members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she will use this loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer for her plantation. She hopes to produce more healthy maize and sell it at a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer for her plantation

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
A breadwinner of the family in a village in Moung Russey district, San is a 48-year-old widower with two dependent daughters who work in a garment factory in Phnom Pen, the capital city of Cambodia. To support his family, for fifteen years he has been farming his own rice farm as his main source of income and has been fishing for additional income. 

San is a third-cycle client with VisionFund. The previous loans have helped him have regular income. He currently earns less than five U.S. dollars per day but is able to save only US$1.5 daily. Now San and his group member are applying for another loan with VisionFund. He plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for his rice paddy. He hopes to increase his crop yield and earn better income to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for his rice paddy

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 32-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan, and a mother of three children.

Heba has a home-based beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase equipment needed for her beauty salon.

Heba is looking to expand her business so that she can improve her family's living conditions and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed for her home-based  beauty salon.

loans.name: Samha

texts.en:
Samha is a 41-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Samha is requesting a loan of 800 JD to finance her son's education expenses.

Due to cultural issues, Samha did not wish to be photographed. The man in the photo is Samha's son.

loans.use: to finance her son's education expenses.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 46-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman; Jordan, and a mother of four children.

Rawan is making knitwear from her home. Rawan started her business using only one machine and now she is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase a new knitwear machine since she started a partnership with a knitwear shop owner to provide him with her products according to a certain profit percentage.

Rawan is looking to open her own shop for knitwear products with an aspiration of purchasing her own car and home.

loans.use: to purchase a new knitwear machine.

loans.name: Seham

texts.en:
Seham is a 38-year-old divorced woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of six children.

Seham is selling clothes, operating from her home. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase more clothes to sell.

Seham is looking to open her own shop so that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 27-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Muna is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do home maintenance. Her aspiration is to improve her family's living conditions and finance her children's education expenses.

Due to cultural issues, Muna did not wish to be photographed. The man in the photo is Muna's husband.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 44-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of five children. She makes pickles and sells olive oil and she is operating from her home.

Sanaa is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase materials needed in making pickles and to purchase olive oil to sell.

Sanaa is looking to rent a plot of land planted with olives trees with an aspiration of purchasing a bigger house that meets her standards.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making pickles in addition to purchasing olive oil.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 41-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of four children. She is breeding birds to sell at a later stage.

Majeda is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more birds to sell with an aspiration of expanding her home.

loans.use: to purchase birds to sell.

loans.name: Saedye

texts.en:
Saedye is a 49-year-old widowed woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Saedye is requesting a loan of 700 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja is a 30-year-old young woman. She is married with three sons and two daughters. Her husband has had a store selling secondhand home furniture and home appliances for one year. It is the only source of income for the family, but not enough to cover the family's needs.

Khadeja wants to share with her husband in purchasing in bulk secondhand home furniture and appliances in order to have a better collection to resell and increase the family's income, so Khadeja is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Khadeja is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand home furniture and appliances to resell

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En del cantón 24 De Mayo, Provincia de Manabi se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
La señora Mariana es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito y por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos. Tiene 59 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero  de esa relación tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes.

Para ganarse el sustento diario después de la muerte de sus esposo ella con todos sus recursos y con la ayuda de uno de los créditos arreglo un local en su casa en la cual puso una pequeña tienda de comestibles, la misma que con el paso de los días  le ha ido mejorando y surtiendo cada día mas con la ayuda de los créditos. Lleva tres años en su negocio y nos cuenta que gracias a el no le falta nada y además se entretiene en su local.  Los fines de semana ella también prepara y vende empanadas, con lo cual se gana algo adicional.

Este crédito es para comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the canton 24 De Mayo, Manabi Province, members of the 'Nuevos Horizontes' communal bank meet. It is a place known for its beautiful scenery and hard-working people who are mostly engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry.
 
59-year-old Mariana is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because the stakes are lower than in other credit institutions, and she appreciates the help they have given with the loans. Her husband died several years ago, but she has 6 children from that relationship who are now older and independent.

In order to make a living following the death of her husband, Mariana used all of her resources and with the help of one of the loans she established a small grocery store in her home. Her business has been improving each day, and with the help of loans she is able to stock her store with more merchandise. Mariana has had her business for three years and she says that thanks to the store she is not missing anything and also enjoys herself at work. On weekends, she prepares and sells empanadas which gives her a little extra income.

This loan will be invested in buying staple goods to stock her store.

Mariana's dreams are to continue to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Silvia Maribel

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo Provincia de Manabi, se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Silvia, tiene 40 años, es casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 23, 21, 18 y 16 años de edad, todos  vive con ella, los 2 menores estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es empleado público.

Ella tiene dos bazares uno en 24 de Mayo y el otro en Montecristi, nos cuenta que en ellos vende ropa, zapatos, cosas para regalos y muchos artículos de bazar, ella viaja todos los días desde su casa hasta la ciudad de Montecristi a atender su negocio, mientras que en el otro local atiende una chica a quien ella le paga un sueldo mensual, ella lleva con su negocio por más de dos años y sus productos para surtir su negocio los compara en Guayaquil y Ambato.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, peluches, tarjetas y muchas otras cosas. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the canton 24 de Mayo, Manabi Province, the members of the communal bank 'Nuevos Horizontes' meet. This area is known for its beautiful scenery and hard-working people who are mainly engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry.
 
40-year-old Silvia lives here. She is married and has four children aged 23, 21, 18 and 16. They all live together, and two of the children are studying at university and college. Her husband is a civil employee.

Silvia has two bazaars, one in 24 de Mayo and the other in Montecristi. She sells clothes, shoes, gift items and many other bazaar goods.
