She travels every day from her home to the town of Montecristi to run her business, while the other bazaar is managed by a local girl who Silvia employs and pays a monthly salary. Silvia has had her business for over two years. She buys the products to stock her store from Guayaquil and Ambato.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, stuffed animals, cards and a variety of other items. This is Silvia's second cycle with the communal bank where she handles the tax regulations, which she enjoys because the payments are easy to make.
 
Silvia's dream is to continue to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, stuffed animals, cards and a variety of other items.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo Provincia de Manabi, se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene 42 años, está separada pero de esa relación tienen dos hijos ambos mayores de  edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella.

Para ganarse el sustento diario ella se dedica a la cría de pollos, para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja en la cual mete hasta cien pollos por temporada, nos cuenta que compra los pollos pequeños en una distribuidora en la ciudad para luego alimentarlos y cuidarlos por tres meses, tiempo necesario para que estén grandes y poder entregarlos a los comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlos a los mercados de la ciudad y la provincia. Ella además trabaja en una casa haciendo labores de limpieza. Nos cuenta que gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio y es así como puede salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas para los mismos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
In the canton 24 de Mayo, Manabi Province, the members of 'Nuevos Horizontes' communal bank meet. This area is known for its beautiful scenery and it's hard-working people who are engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry.
 
Blanca, 42, lives here. She is separated from her husband and has two older children from the relationship, one of whom still lives with her.

To earn her daily bread, Blanca raises chickens and has a small farm where she breeds 100 chickens per season. She says that she buys baby chicks from a distributor in the city and after feeding and caring for three months they are big enough and she is able to sell them to large traders, who come to her home to take them to the city and provincial markets. She also works as a cleaner in another house. Blanca is thankful for the loans that have helped her to start her business, and through them she has been able to succeed.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens, and food and medicine for them. Blanca has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because thanks to the loans she was able to start her business.

Blanca's dreams are to continue to succeed in life and in her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, and food and medicine for them.

loans.name: Sandra Marlene

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo Provincia de Manabi, se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Sandra, tiene 35 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  una niña de  6 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Ella es Lic. En  Ciencias de la Educación.  Esta desde el inicio en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad de pertenecer a este grupo y así poder recibir  los beneficios del banco.

Trabaja como maestra en una escuela privada en la localidad y también se dedica a la venta de productos Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella realiza sus ventas en los momentos que está desocupada de sus labores de maestra y también les vende a sus compañeras y madres de familia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.
 
Sus sueños son tener un bazar y un nombramiento del Estado en una escuela o colegio.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) communal bank meets in the 24 de Mayo canton in the Manabi Province.  This place is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard working people who devote themselves to farming and raising animals.

This is where we meet Sandra, age 35.  She is the single mother of a six year old daughter who goes to school.  She has a Bachelor’s Degree in Education.  She has been a member of the communal bank ever since it started.  She likes it because of the opportunity to belong to this group.  That way she is able to receive the benefits of the bank.

She works as a teacher in a private school in the area.  She also sells Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She makes her sales during the time when she is not busy with her work as a teacher.  She also sells to her colleagues and mothers of her students.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects every eight days.  She has been doing this business activity for two years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use the loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and jewelry.

Her dreams are to have a variety store and an appointment to a state school.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and jewelry.

loans.name: Nuevos Emprendedores (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Emprendedores está conformado por 4 socios y 3 socias quienes laboran en diferentes actividades, las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y salir en adelante con sus familias. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia del país, se caracteriza por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan,  por la belleza de sus paisajes, por su naturaleza, y por la cultura y tradiciones de su gente quienes son personas cálidas y amables. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Zoila, tiene 55 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, 2 son casados y viven independientes, dos son solteros, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente,  y último hijo estudia en una universidad de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios en una unidad de taxi que es propio, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Zoila se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en su casa se encarga del cuidado de sus nietos.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.
 
Su sueño es  comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Emprendedores communal bank is comprised of four men and three women.  They work at different business activities.  These businesses allow them to pay for the household expenses and to get ahead with their families.  They live in the city of Cuenca, which is the country’s third most important city.  The city is known for the four rivers that bathe it, the beautiful scenery, its nature, and for the culture and traditions of its residents who are characteristically kind and cordial.

Zoila, age 55, is one of the members of this group.  She is married and has five children who are all adults.  Two of them are married and live independently.  Two are single, work, and help her financially.  Her last child goes to the city’s university.  Her husband is a driver, and he works providing taxi service in his own vehicle.  The house they live in is their own.

Zoila devotes herself to the household chores.  As she spends most of her time at home, she cares for her grandchildren.

This is her second loan in her communal bank.  She will use it to buy provisions for her home.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy provisions.

loans.name: La Ponderosa (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Ponderosa está formado por 8 socias y un socio quienes viven por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, su arquitectura es una mezclada entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Nuestras socias son personas amables, gentiles y carismáticas, se caracterizan por ser personas luchadoras, emprendedoras y siempre ven en cada día una nueva oportunidad para salir en adelante conjuntamente con sus familias. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Miriam, tiene 34 años, está separada de su esposo y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Miriam es de profesión estilista y labora en un salón de belleza que es propio, se encuentra en el negocio hace 6 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como son tintes, shampoo, gel, y otros productos de belleza para su local. 

Su meta es tener un Spa.
texts.en:
“La Ponderosa” (The Pine Tree) communal bank is composed of 1 male and 8 female members who live in the Monay sector of Cuenca city. This city is also known as Santa Ana de los 4 Rios (Santa Ana of the 4 Rivers). Its architecture is mixed colonial and modern and its people maintain their culture and the traditions of their villages. The members are kind, gentle, and charismatic people, known for being determined, entrepreneurial, and they always see in each day a new opportunity to get ahead together with their families.

One member of this group is Miriam, 34 years old, who is separated from her husband. While married, she gave birth to a son, now 8 years old, who studies in a small school in the city. She owns the house in which they live.

Miriam is a hair stylist by profession and works in her own beauty salon. She has been in the business 6 years and works Monday through Saturday, from 8:00 am until 8:00 at night.

This is Miram's 3rd loan through her communal bank and she will invest it in purchasing products such as hair coloring, shampoo, gel, and other beauty products for her salon. Miriam's goal is to have her own spa.

loans.use: buy hair coloring, shampoo, gel, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a 64-year-old married woman. She lives in Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Brigida plants, harvests and sells bananas for a living. She's been in the business for 20 years and gains 2,000 PHP a month from this business. She has requested a loan of 4,433 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

In 2011, Brigida joined GDMPC to seek assistance to improve her business. She hopes to improve their living conditions and to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:

Elvie owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice to sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

In 2011, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Vivian

Vivian owns and operates a farm planting & harvesting rice to sell to earn a living and she's been in this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2007, Vivian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Maribeth operates a business in the agriculture sector, planting & harvesting gabi (a "root plant" known in English as Taro)  to sell to earn a living. She's been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

In 2012, Maribeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she hopes to grow her business to improve the living conditions of their family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with two children. Rosalinda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosalinda is a farmer. She's engaged in banana and root plant "gabi" (taro) production to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years and every month she earns 2,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

Recently, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Charlyn has a business venture in the retail sector, selling a variety of home use products. Charlyn has been engaged in her business for 4 years and earns 2,000 a month for these activities.

Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Mercedita

Mercedita owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she has been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Mercedita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Mercedita wants to build a house and to ensure her children finish their study .

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 41, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Rowena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Rowena hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

Lolita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Joane

texts.en:
This is Joane, 40, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and mother to her child. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Joane maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 41,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy merchandise and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Joane dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:

She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jean operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jean hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

As to prove it's success, she's been able to raise crabs. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase additional fish and crabs to raise. Positively, she hopes to be able to further grow up her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and crabs to raise.

loans.name: Rosebella

Rosebella used her last loan to buy school supplies and more stock to sell. Her business is successful and she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In the future, she hopes to gain double the profit from her business.

loans.name: Ma. Sally

texts.en: Ma. Sally is married and has four children. Ma. Sally is 40 years old. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Ma. Sally is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. In 2011, Ma. Sally joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Ma. Sally wants to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Jipargul

texts.ru: Жыпаргул родилась на юге Кыргызстана, в простой семье фермера и с детства помогала родителям по хозяйству. Жыпаргул вышла замуж в 19 лет и в 1989, 1990 и 1993 годах родила двух дочерей и сына. В 1994 года, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Жыпаргул начала перепродавать рис на рынке г. Ош (юг страны).Через 2 года, она накопила денег за счет перепродажи риса, и переехала со своей семьей в столицу Бишкек, где  начала перепродавать обувь на местном рынке. Начав свой бизнес с суммы 35,000 сом (KGS), она смогла стать успешным предпринимателем со своими постоянными клиентами. В 2000 году Жыпаргул,  родив младшего сына, взяла кредит на развитие бизнеса  и стала сама возить обувь из Китая, найдя в качестве партнеров – оптовых покупателей из соседнего Казахстана.  Доходы позволили Жыпаргул купить дом для семьи. К сожалению, бизнес Жыпаргул рухнул в тот день, когда ее партнеры, взяв партию товара под реализацию, скрылись, оставив ее в огромных долгах.  Жыпаргул пришлось продать недвижимость в г.Бишкек и в 2010 году переехать в село Вознесеновка. Супруг Жыпаргул, будучи ее главной опорой в жизни, всегда  помогал и поддерживал жену в трудные моменты жизни в их семье. Он начал бизнес в животноводстве, сделав его семейным бизнесом  и привлек Жыпаргул в его развитие. Благодаря настойчивости и упорству семьи Жыпаргул, на сегодняшний день в их хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы и один бычок, ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов составляет около 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаргул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы Жыпаргул с мужем мечтают вложить  в постройку хорошего дома и дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Jipargul was born in southern Kyrgyzstan, in a simple farmer's family, and from an early age she started helping her parents on the farm. Jipargul got married at the age of 19, and gave birth to two daughters and a son in 1989, 1990 and 1993.  In 1994, in search of a source of income for her family, she began to resell rice at the market in Osh (southern Kyrgyzstan).  After two years, she had gathered enough money by reselling rice, and she moved with her family to the capital, Bishkek.  There, she worked as a shoe reseller at a local market. Launching her business with an initial amount of 35,000 som (KGS), she became a successful entrepreneur who had regular customers. In 2000, after giving birth to her youngest son, Jipargul took a loan to expand her business and started to import shoes from China, using wholesale buyers from neighboring Kazakhstan as business partners.  With the revenues generated from this business, Jipargul was able to buy a house for her family.  Unfortunately, her business collapsed on the day when her partners disappeared with a shipment of merchandise, leaving her with huge debts.  Jipargul had to sell her property in Bishkek and in 2010 she moved to the village of Voznesenovka.  Her husband, being her main support in life, always helped and supported his wife during the family's difficult times.  He started to work in animal husbandry, turning his activity into a family business and encouraged Jipargul to join him.  Thanks to the perseverance and tenacity of Jipargul's family, their farming business now comprises two dairy cows and a bull and brings about 10,000 som (KGS) per month through the sale of dairy and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Jipargul has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of
100,000 som (KGS) which will be used to buy additional livestock. Jipargul and her husband now have one dream: to use future revenues to build a good house and to further increase their number of farm animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 33-year-old married father of three children. He lives in Hadramout, Yemen. His educational background is only primary school. He has a grocery store where he sells food and daily home requirements. He started his business long ago and it is the only source of income for him and his family. 

He introduced additional services in addition to grocery goods such as telecommunications and medical services for the people who have urgent needs because of living far away from town.

Recently, Hassan's business faces a financial challenge leading to a decrease in his profit. He has stopped providing people's requirements because of the current bad situations that Yemen has been facing.

Hassan is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase goods to continue supplying clients' requests.

In the future, Hassan is planning to expand his grocery to become a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his grocery

loans.name: Basit

texts.en: Basit is married and a father of three children. He is 33 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Basit used his last loan to buy snack items to resell. His business is flourishing. Now he is busy with his other business, which is running a general store. Now he is taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand his product offering. In the future, he hopes to become prosperous in business.

loans.name: Cerenisa

Cerenisa is providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for three years and every month she earns PHP 1,300 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

In 2010, Cerenisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Cerenisa hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline is age 36 and married with 3 children who are between 15 and 1 years old. He has been in farming for four years and currently employs two farmhands on his farm. He produces cabbages, maize and passionfruit for the local market. He runs a butchery business in addition to farming.

Frankline has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him boost his farming by buying irrigation pipes to ensure he has constant water supply on his farm. He is optimistic his farming income will grow and enable him to educate his children.

He says the challenge is unpredictable weather conditions resulting in crop failure.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:

She is borrowing her first loan from KADET of KES 30,000, which she intends to use to purchase video tapes, DVDs and CDs to add more stock to the business. She will use the anticipated profit from the business to repay the loan and to boost her business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open another shop.

loans.use: To purchase tapes, DVDs, and CDs to sell

loans.name: Nenita

She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nenita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She meets up faithfully with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

Rosalinda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food and products for the home in the local community. Rosalinda has been in her business for five years and earns 6,000 PHP a month.

Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product range. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 46 years old, married to Jacob and they have three children. She has sold second hand clothes for the last four years earning a monthly income from the business of Kes 28,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of Kes 30,000 with KADET ltd. She will use the loan to purchase bails of used clothes. She plans to purchase a plot with the anticipated profit from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Deonila

texts.en:
This is Deonila, she is 60 years old and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Genaro, her business partner, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Deonila operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Deonila hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with two children. She is 29 years old and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Amina operates a business venture, which provides computer services to local community members to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more video game equipment to improve the business. 

In 2011, Amina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Amina wants to have some savings as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more video game equipment to improve the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Glynne

texts.en:
Glynne is 31 years old. Glynne is a married woman with three children. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. Glynne is starting a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 from the business. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

In 2011, Glynne joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Glynne wants to build house and to pay for her children to finish studying.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Zaphaniah

texts.en:
Zephaniah is 28 years old, married to Elizabeth and they have been blessed with one child. He makes bricks for sale. He has been in this business for six years and earns a monthly income of KES 18,000.

He is taking his first loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to increase the brick-making capacity in the project. He will do this by employing casual laborers and purchasing brick-making equipment. With the anticipated profits he plans to buy more land and build rental houses. 

His hopes and dreams are to educate his kids in order for them to have a bright future.

loans.use: To increase the brick-making capacity of his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is a 34-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

To earn a living, Charlita runs a fish-selling business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been in this business for eleven years, and each month, she earns PHP 2,000 from it. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. 

In 2008, Charlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Charlita wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya where he produces tea, milk, bananas and eggs for the local market. He is aged 47 and married with three children of school-going ages. He has fifteen years of experience in active farming.

Charles has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy poultry birds for 40,000 KES and piglets for 20,000 KES. He says this will improve his ability to supply larger markets. He is optimistic about the future business prospects.

Charles says high costs of labour offered by farmhands is a great challenge.

loans.use: To buy poultry and piglets.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old, residing at Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Philippines. Erlinda is married and has two children.

To earn a living, Erlinda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products. She has been in this business for six years, and from it she earns PHP 3,000 a month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase new items so she can expand her product offering. In 2011, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Erlinda wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 23 years old, married, and blessed with two children. He has been farming in his locality for the last two years, and earns a monthly income of KES 4,000.

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the KES 30,000 to purchase seeds and to till the land in preparation for planting. The profits will be ploughed back and used to increase the acreage of the farm.

He hopes to own a larger farm and improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and to till the land.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is from Libertad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old. Rosalina is married with one child.

To make a living, Rosalina owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of home-use products in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for five years and from it earns approximately 1,300 PHP a month.

Rosalina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2008, Rosalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 29 years old and single with one child.  She does farming on her hired piece of land in her locality and has been in operation for last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

Nancy is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the KES 30,000 to purchase fertilizers. With the anticipated profits she will set up a retail shop.

Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is 36 years old. She lives in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Nelly is a married woman with four children. To earn a living, Nelly is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She's been 11 years in this business. Each month, she earns about PHP 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. In 2008, Nelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of tools and product items needed in her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a father of 6 adult children and lives in Murang'a area of Central Kenya where he has been into active farming for 10 solid years after his retirement from formal employment. He gets additional income from a pension scheme.

John has requested a loan of 84,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a pedigreed dairy cow. He says he wants to raise only the best breeds to ensure he gets high returns. He previously acquired a loan of 50,000 KES which he repaid promptly. He hopes to improve his living standards with the loan and adds that the skills he has acquired in 10 years of active farming will be a great help.

John feels that the high cost of feeds is the major undoing in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 37 years old, married to Chege, and they have been blessed with seven children. She has been buying and selling maize for the last two years, earning a monthly income of about KES 3,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of KES 25,000 from KADET, which she intends to use to purchase maize for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to be a cereal distributor.

loans.use: To purchase maize for resale.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is a married woman with three children. She is 33 years old. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. To earn a living, she is operating a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 2,000 KES doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 KES to repair a fishing boat used in her business. In 2008, Luciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat used in her business.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Randu

texts.en:
Randu lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and has two children. Randu owns a retail shop which has been in operation for two years. Mariakani is an upcoming town along the highway that links the Coastal area to the other parts of the country.

He was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional retail stock, e.g. salt, sugar, flour, fat, etc. He aspires to own a wholesale shop in the area in the future. He will use the extra income from this loan to complete a building project: his own residential house.

loans.use: To purchase additional retail stock, e.g. salt, sugar, flour, fat, etc.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is aged 38 and married with 5 children between the ages of 15 and 7 years. She has been farming for 14 years and currently employs one farmhand on her farm. She sells her products of milk, tea and eggs to the local market.

Evaline has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her boost her poultry business by buying more birds and thus produce more eggs for the local market. She adds that the loan will enable her to meet the basic family requirements with much ease.

She laments the high cost of acquiring capital to do heavy commercial farming, but reiterates the benefits of Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is 48 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one child. Florencia used her last loan to buy daily use commodities to sell in her retail store. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a resident and a farmer in Murang'a area of Central Kenya where she has been practicing farming for over 15 years. Her farm produces eggs, pigs, beans and milk for the local market.

Lucy has requested a loan of 84,800 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow. She believes the acquisition of a better breed will boost her farming income and enable her to earn more income to meet her family's daily needs, as well as continue to expand her business and make it more reliable for family upkeep.

She laments of the poor climate and limited financial services.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 25 years. She operates a store where she sells mangoes, kale, cabbages and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the loan to purchase more potatoes and cabbages. Carol's business goal is to venture into running a retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages and potatoes.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique, a 57-year-old married father of four children, resides in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines where for the past three years he has operated a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community, each month earning PHP3,600.00.

Enrique joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation and is now requesting a loan of PHP10,000.00 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. In the future, he wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Jiparkul

texts.ru: Жыпаркул 64 года, вдова, воспитала пятерых детей и сейчас является бабушкой шести внуков. Жыпаркул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве еще в 1992 году, стартовав с покупки одной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Жыпаркул, ее хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день три дойные коровы, четыре теленка и одну лошадь,  приносит около 4,200 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Жыпаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Jiparkul is a 64-year-old widow.  She has raised five children and now has six grandchildren.  Jiparkul started her own animal husbandry business in 1992 with the purchase of one cow.  Thanks to Jiparkul's hard work, her farming business now comprises three dairy cows, four calves and one horse, and brings about 4,200 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Jiparkul has turned to  Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som, which will be used to purchase sheep.  Jiparkul plans to invest her revenues to further increase her number of farm animals.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 46, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Johnmar, a goldsmith. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Josephine operates a jewelry store. She sells gold jewelry. She also earns income through clients who would like to have their broken jewelry repaired. She is the one who manages the financial and marketing side of their business together with her husband, the goldsmith. She also sells electronic load for additional income. Her store is located in the marketplace. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 45,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials needed in their jewelry business. She expects a boost in her business income as they expand their business.  

Josephine dreams of expanding her store and helping her family through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in their jewelry-making business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old. Edwin is a widow and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Edwin owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edwin has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

Edwin is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2008, Edwin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley has been  a farmer in Litein for 9 solid years within his home area. He produces milk  and runs a retail shop besides farming. He is aged 35 and married with two children aged 3 and 2 years.

Wesley has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff-cutter for his dairy farming business. He says it will boost his feeding and reduce wastage of costly feeds. He is glad about the business. He is glad that  Juhudi Kilimo is making loans to smallholder farmers and helping them do farming in a more commercial way.

Wesley says animal diseases and poor weather are his major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a chuff-cutter (to cut fodder).

loans.name: Kimanzi

texts.en: Kimanzi is a 72-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 12 to 30 years. He operates a food market where he sells sugar, maize flour, salt, soap, etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the loan kes 10,000 to purchase more wheat flour and cooking fat. His business goal is to run another retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old. Wilma is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general) store, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 29-year-old single man.  He has no children yet. He operates a Nissan van in which he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for two years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of maintenance. He will use the loan to pay for the repair cost of his Nissan. His business goal is to be the best service provider within five years.

loans.use: To pay for his vehicle repair expenses.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлюбе 45 лет, вдова, имеет троих детей. Матлюба работает социальным работником  и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, 15 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Имея практический опыт в животноводстве, Матлюба успешно развивает свое хозяйство, приносящее на сегодняшний день около 15,000 сом от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов, а также выращивает хлопок. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Матлюба обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Матлюба планирует вложить в реконструкцию сарая для того, чтобы улучшить условия содержания скота, а в будущем - купить машину для своей семьи.
texts.en: Matluba is 45 years old, a widow and has three children.  She works as a social worker to bring in additional income for her family.  She got involved in animal husbandry and farming 15 years ago.  Having practical experience in animal husbandry, Matluba successfully grows her business, which now yields about 15,000 som from sales of dairy and meat products and also from growing cotton.  In order to further develop her business, Matluba requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the profits from the loan into repairing a barn, in order to improve conditions for keeping livestock, and in the future, plans to purchase a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en: Felicity is a married woman. She has a daughter who is six years old. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes when buying them. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to diversify into selling shoes within five years.

loans.use: To buy more stock of  clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
This is Cherry, 30, a resident of Tanza,Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a driver, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Cherry operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruit that is native to the Philippines like bananas and pineapples which are grown mostly in the southern region of Luzon. She also sells other Filipino fruit staples.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cherry dreams of  growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Kanymbu

texts.ru: Канымбу  проживает в селе Ленин жолу на юге Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Канымбу    с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день,   Канымбу содержит бычков в своем хозяйстве, продажа мясных продуктов позволяет зарабатывать для семьи около 9,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса,   Канымбу  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов для откорма и  перепродажи.    Доходы   Канымбу планирует вложить в постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Kanymbu lives in the Lenin-Zhol village in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Much like many families in the rural area, Kanymbu and her husband fatten up livestock, having started this business with an initial sum of 8,000 som (KGS).  Today, she keeps bulls in her household, and sales of meat products allows the family to earn about 9,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further expand her business, Kanymbu requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the profits into building a large shed for livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.ru: Юсуф проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается выращиванием и торговлей овощей. Кроме того он сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Yusuf lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 31 years old, married and has three children.  He is involved in growing and selling vegetables.  Besides this, he plants fruit trees.  He has been in this business for six years.  Yusuf is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 36 years old, married to Josephine, and they have three children. He is a small-scale farmer in his locality and has been in operation for the last two years, earning a monthly income of Kes 8,000. 

He is taking out his first loan of Kes 30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans  to use the loan  to purchase farm inputs, i.e fertilizers and seeds.  With the anticipated profits he will educate his children and improve the farm.

His hopes and dreams are to improve his farming operations as well as the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs (fertilizers and seeds).

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en:
Enkhtuvshin is a 35-year-old married woman who lives with her family in a small apartment in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her elder child, a son, attends secondary school, while her spouse works as a director at a local company.  

Since Enkhtuvshin’s major is in technology, she supports her family by operating a translating service business at home. She receives mail or gets news about the mining sector from international websites, translates it, and sends it to local mining companies. In the last few years in Mongolia, the mining sector is very popular, therefore she can do her job at home and also take care of her baby daughter.  

Thus, she is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase support facilities such as a hard disk and one more computer and other necessary things which will be very useful for her profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary facilities for her translating service.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 46 years old, married to Samson, and they have eight children. She has been practicing small-scale farming in her locality for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 5,000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET of Kes 20,000 which she will use to purchase farm inputs, i.e., fertilizers and seeds. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children and also improve the farm.

She dreams of improving her farm and producing more and educating her children to greater levels.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, i.e., fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is taking another Kiva loan of 50,000 to boost her retail shop business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and pay for her business permit. The previous loan had a lot of impact as she was able to stock her retail shop which increased her monthly income. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale and pay for business permit.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is  a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya, aged 43 and with 12 years of experience in farming and specifically the dairy, tea and poultry farming business.She is married with two children aged 15 and 6 years and both schooling.

Irene has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her farming business. She has plans to use half of the loan to buy more poultry birds and the other half to buy a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to continue improving her farming so as to make it her core business and meet her family needs from it. She would also like to buy more land for more commercial-based farming.

Irene says the challenge is in their limited parcels of land and poor market prices for farm produce.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 23 to 29 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a general store where she sells bread, flour, sugar, salt etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of items sold. 

Elizabeth will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, wheat flour, salt, etc. Her business goal are to expand the retail store and run another retail store within five years.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, bread, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 20 to 36 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of buying cereals. She will use the loan to purchase more cereals. Her business goal is to run another cereal retail stall within five years.

loans.use: To buy more cereals.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
This is Nelly, 32, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Felicio, a carpenter, and father to her children. 

Together with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nelly retails peanuts. She buys peanuts in bulk, cooks and repacks them to be sold around their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more stocks of peanuts to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nelly dreams to be able to give her all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of peanuts needed in her business.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Keneth is a farmer in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. He is 32 and also works as a driver. He is married and has two children, age 8 and 4 years. His farm produce of milk and tea are sold within the local market. He has been farming for 10 years.

Keneth has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him in constructing a zero-grazing unit for his dairy animals as well as buying more poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He is focused on diversifying his farming business to mitigate the chances of complete failure and maintain a steady income. His main need is to educate the children.

Keneth is glad Juhudi Kilimo is advancing farmers loans and with a grace period factored in for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit and buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his computer shop.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman. She has a daughter who is two years old. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, bread, flour, salt, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of buying the items. 

She will use the loan to buy more of the items such as sugar, flour, salt, bread, etc. Her business goal is to expand her retail store into wholesale within five years.

loans.use: To buy more items such as flour, sugar, salt, bread, etc.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya, dealing mainly in dairy and tea farming. He is 26 but has been in the farming business since he was a teenager. He currently runs his farm with the help of one farmhand. He runs a tea retail business in the local market.

Benard has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to help him buy a knapsack sprayer and as well as construct a dairy unit. He says his income will go up with the help of the loan. He hopes the assets will help in improving his farming income and enable him live a better life.

He sees the lack of ready capital as the major challenge in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy a knapsack sprayer and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene is a 27-year-old lady who lives with her daughter and husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, that lacks basic infrastructure. Her daughter attends local secondary school. 

Her major business is as a tour manager, but she has supported her family by operating a restaurant/café/pub business for one year. Her café/pub is located in the very busy entertainment section of the city, so her business is very popular. Oyun-Erdene’s spouse helps her. She has 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital.  

In recent times, her customers have been asking for a karaoke room, and Oyun-Erdene doesn't want to lose her clients. Thus she wants to buy two karaoke machines in order to improve her business. So she is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase two karaoke machines.

loans.use: two purchase two karaoke machines.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a single young woman. She has no children. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for one year. Her business challenge is the high cost of the products sold. 

She will use the loan of KES 10,000 to buy more products like sugar, salt, maize flour, etc. 

In the next five years, Eva hopes to run a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more home products such as sugar, salt, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, bed sheets, towels, toothpaste, soap, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, 26, is the mother of three children with the first born already in school. She has been in farming for eight years in her home area of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. Her farming is currently run with the help of one farmhand and produces milk and tomatoes for the local market.

Betty has requested a loan of  60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuffcutter at 30,000 KES to help in feeding her dairy cows and to buy poultry birds also at the same price to boost her poultry farming income. She wants to use her farming income to educate her children and improve their living standards. 

Betty is worried about the weather and animal diseases but remains optimistic that farming is headed for better times, especially with the loans availed by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy a chuffcutter and poultry birds

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno, 36, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a poultry-keeping business, selling from home and at the market to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing chicken feed. She dreams of expanding and hiring more employees in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more chicks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, sardines, etc. to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic bowls and soap-making materials in large quantity in order to produce a large quantity of bars of soap for sale.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Гулбахор занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. В этой области она 11 лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Gulbahor lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 41 years old, married and has three children.  Gulbahor is involved in breeding cattle.  She has been in this business for 11 years.  The goal of obtaining this loan is to purchase small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Aygun

texts.ru:
Aygun uje 4 qoda kak imeyet svoy magazin dlya prodaji pishevix produktov, ranshe ona rabotala prodavshicey v drugom magazine a potom otkrila svoy. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy v posolke Kurdmakhmudlu.
Aygun 27 let, ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Aygun ochen trudolubiviy chelovek ona s malix let rabotayet tak kak oni jivut v dvoyom so svoyey mamoy kotoraya ne v sostoyanii rabotat tak kak ona bolna. Aygun seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit svoy magazin.
texts.en: Aygun has had her store, where she sells food products, for four years.  She previously worked as a salesperson at another store and then opened her own.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the Fuzuli city and now lives with her mother in the Kurdmakhmudlu village in the Fuzuli region.  Aygun is 27 years old.  She is not married and has no children.  Aygun is a very hardworking person and has been working since an early age because she lives together with her mother, who is unable to work due to an illness.  Aygun currently needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her store.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy exercise books to add to his business inventory.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is married and has three children from six months to 10 years. She operates a grocery store where she sells passion fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Dorcas is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy passion fruits. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortages of passion fruits. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to purchase passion fruits t sell.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 25 years old and single. He has been in the farming business in his locality for the last two years, supplying vegetables and fruits to nearby markets and other local buyers and earning a monthly income of KES 8,200.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET ltd of KES 20,000. He plans to use the funds to purchase seeds and fertilizer and to till the land. The anticipated profits will be used to expand the farm. His dreams are to increase his farm's production and to have a family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer and to till the land.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 32-year-old single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as determined. 

Geoffrey operates a retail store where he sells sugar, salt, tea leaves, bread, and flour, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving his store. He will use this loan of KES 20,000 to buy items such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, and soap, etc. for resale. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more tea leaves, sugar, rice, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy petrol, kerosene, engine oil, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is 24 years old. He is a tea farmer in the Rift Valley. He has been in operation for the last year, earning a monthly income of KES 10,834.

Noah is requesting his first loan from KADET ltd of KES 15,000. He plans to use the funds to purchase tea seedlings for transplanting to his farm. The profits will be used to expand the tea farm and plant more tea bushes. His dream is to own a large tea farm.

loans.use: To purchase tea seedlings for transplanting.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама Зебинисо открыла маленький продуктовый магазин. В этой области она десять лет. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов и приобретения небольшого холодильника.
texts.en: Zebiniso lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 35 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation.  Zebiniso opened a small food store.  She has been in this business for ten years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase products and a small refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase products and a small refrigerator

loans.name: Jipar

texts.ru:
Жыпар  40 лет, замужем, воспитывает троих детей . Основным источником дохода для Жыпар является животноводство, начатое ею 15 лет назад.  Стартовав свой бизнес с суммы в 25,000 сом (KGS), Жыпар смогла развить свое хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 6,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 13 коз, 7 овец, заготовлено 5 телег сена, и 600 кг ячменя.    
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов овец. Доходы Жыпар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Jipar is 40 years old, married and is raising three children.  Animal husbandry, which she started 15 years ago, is Jipar's primary source of income.  Having started this business with a sum of 25,000 som (KGS), she was able to grow her business to have a monthly profit of 6,000 som (KGS).  Today, her business has 13 goats and 7 sheep, a stock of 5 carts of hay and 600 kilograms of barley.  In order to further develop her business, Jipar requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of sheep.  She plans to invest the profits into increasing livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 58-year-old married man. He has five children, ranging in age from 20 to 30 years old. He describes himself as focused. 

Peter operates a school where he provides education. He has been involved in this business for seven years and employs 11 staff members. His primary customers are students who range in age from 4 to 14 years old. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the school. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy 10 additional desks. Peter's business goal is to run a secondary school within five years.

loans.use: To buy 10 additional desks for his school.

loans.name: Sulduz

texts.ru: Sulduz yavlyayetsya uchitelem nacionalnix muzikalnix instrumentov uje 7 let. On uchit v osnovnom detey malix vozrastov. Sulduz 40 let , on jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotorix toje nauchil ispolnat na nacionalnix instrumentax. Sulduz jivet v Baku regione vmeste so sovyey jenoy i detmi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nacionalniye instrumenti "Tar" ,"Kamancha" chtobi uchit detey muzike.
texts.en: Sulduz has been a national musical instruments teacher for seven years.  He mainly teaches young children.  Sulduz is 40 years old, married and has two children, whom he also taught to perform with national instruments.  Sulduz lives in the Baku region together with his wife and children.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to purchase national instruments, such as "Tar" and "Kamancha," in order to teach music to children.

loans.use: to purchase national instruments

loans.name: Daniella

texts.en: Daniella is a 33-year-old married woman. She describes herself as very determined. She operates a a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are households. She describes her biggest business challenge as being inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more maize, beans and rice. Daniella's business goal is to run a large scale supermarket within five years.

loans.use: To buy more maize, beans and rice.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 31 years old. she is married to Samson and they are blessed with four children. She owns a retail shop in her locality and has been in operation for the last seven years earning a monthly income of KES 7,000.

She has borrowed KES 20, 000 from KADET Ltd, which she will use to purchase sugar, maize flour and cooking oil. She hopes to use the profits to educate her children and improve the level of stock in her business.

Her hopes are to succeed in her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her shop.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Everline dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of oranges, tomatoes, onions and mangoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of oranges, tomatoes, onions and mangoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bottles of water, drinks and provisions in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Marapat

texts.ru: Марапат 53 года, замужем. В поисках источника финансирования, в 1980 году Марапат начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с покупки дойной коровы.  Благодаря упорному труду Марапат, на сегодня ее хозяйство позволяет получать прибыль около 8,500 сом (KGS) в месяц. Благодаря доходам от бизнес - деятельности Марапат смогла приобрести машину для своей семьи. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марапат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых овец. Доходы от кредита Марапат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
