texts.en: Marapat is 53 years, married.  In search of a financial source, Marapat started her animal husbandry business in 1980, with an initial purchase of a dairy cow.  Thanks to her persistent work, her business currently allows her to make a profit of about 8,500 som (KGS) per month.  Thanks to profits from the business, Marapat was able to purchase a car for her family.  In order to develop her business further, she requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase thoroughbred sheep.  Marapat plans to invest the profit from the loan into increase her domestic livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jacquline

texts.en:
Jacquline is 43 years old and has been farming for 15 years in her home area of Muranga in Central Kenya. She is married and has two children, ages 16 and 13, who both attend school. Her farm currently produces coffee and vegetables for the local market.

Jacquline has made a 63,600 KES loan request with Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she will save the income to ensure the children are educated. She is focusing on having four dairy cows to produce more than 100 litres of milk per day.

She says the challenge to her business is fluctuating milk prices. She remains optimistic with the business prospects.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 38 years old, married, and has five children. She has been a green grocer for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,900.

This marks Martha's first loan with KADET Ltd. of KES 30,000. She will use the funds to purchase stocks of green vegetables, onions, and potatoes for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to grow the business into a big grocery store and educate her children to college level.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables, onions, and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old, married to Mohamed, and they have two children. She has run a retail shop for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of KES 30,000, which she intends to use to purchase cooking fat, maize flour, and sugar for her business. Her hope is to have a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchse stock of maize flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old, married to Ochieng, and they have three children. She has been a tailor for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,700. 

She is requesting for her first loan with KADET of Kes 20,000. She plans to use the loan to buy stocks of clothing materials and sewing accessories. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

Her hope is to grow her business and employ one more staff.

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothing materials and  sewing accesories.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 34 years old, married to Samuel, and they have been blessed with three children. She has been rearing pigs and selling maize for the last five years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 30,000, which she intends to use to purchase pig feed and maize stocks.

Her dream is to educate her kids.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and maize stocks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy dozens of shoes to add to her business.

loans.name: Winnyrose

texts.en:
Winnyrose is a resident of Litein and has been farming for six years. She currently produces milk and tea for the local markets.

Winnyrose has requested a second loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow to boost her dairy farming business. She says the skills she has acquired in farming will help her in managing her cows in order to reap the best benefits from her business. Her main aim is to pay for the education of her two children and to improve her family's standard of living through the provision of basic needs.

She states the major challenge is the unreliable artificial insemination services for cows, which makes determination of breeds production capacity quite difficult. She is happy though with Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gladwell

texts.en:
Gladwell is 41 years and married. She has been successfully running a clothing boutique business for the past four years. 

Gladwell is requesting her second loan from KADET for 60,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers, and dresses to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. Her dream is to expand her business and own a bigger boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers, and dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cellphone accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, shampoos, conditioners and hair weaves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock feed, chicks, and medicines

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian is 28 years old, married to Macharia, and together they have three children. She has had a primary school for the last 10 years, from which she earns a monthly income of 78,500 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She is borrowing her second loan from KADET Ltd of 100,000 KES. She will use the funds to repair desks and classrooms. She plans to use the anticipated profit to construct more classrooms. 

Her hopes and dreams are to make the school a center of excellence.

loans.use: To repair desk and classrooms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Carren Benta

texts.en:
Carren Benta is a 56-year-old poultry farmer in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and has been doing this business for the last two years with success. 

This is her third loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more chicks for rearing on her farm. She sells chicken and eggs to her customers. The proceeds from the business will be used in the expansion of her business and for repaying her loan. She hopes to excel in this business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, aged 27 years, is a hardworking man who hails from Kagadi, Uganda. He is the proud owner of a produce store in the same town, a business he has done for 3 years, having started from farming. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business. He dreams of building a permanent home and educating his 3 children.

Moses wants a loan to buy groundnuts and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and coffee to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy blank compact discs and for payment of filming costs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 23 years old, single and supporting three people. She has operated an M-PESA business (mobile-phone based money transfer service) for the last four years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

She is borrowing her first loan from KADET Ltd. of 30,000 KES. She will use the funds to increase her cash float (the minimum amount of cash to be maintained by each dealer required by the mobile money transfer service operator) for the M-PESA money transfer service. With the anticipated profit, she will employ extra staff. 

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business into a multi-billion empire.

loans.use: to increase cash float for M-PESA (mobile-phone based money transfer service)

loans.name: Abeteraine Kyenkonge Group

texts.en:
Fabiano, aged 40 years, is a married man who hails from Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in a local brew that is commonly known as waragi by the locals. This is a business he has done for 5 years, having started as a farmer. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business.

He dreams of building a permanent home and educating his 7 children. His business dream is to be able to supply alcohol to the capital city where there is a ready market. He wants a loan to buy alcohol for resale.

Fabiano is a member of a group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy alcohol for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is a 20-year-old student who lives with his family in Irbid. He is in his third year majoring in Anthropology. Hazem is hoping to get his bachelor degree and continue in higher education. He also wants to find a job in the field of anthropology so he can apply what he has studied.
Hazem is now applying for a loan to pay his semester fees for registration in the university.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old. She and her husband Albert have three children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

She is borrowing her first loan from KADET LTD for 30,000 KES, with which she plans to purchase bales of second-hand clothes for her business. She will save the anticipated profits from the business for her farming project.

She hopes to start a farming business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 50-year-old divorced woman. In order to support herself, Maryam decided to start a small home-based business buying and selling home products, specifically kitchen items that are mainly made of melamine. On the side she also sells a few accessories based on the season and what her customers are looking for.
Today Maryam is applying for a loan in order to buy more products in the hope of attracting more customers.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 43 years old, married, and has four children age 2, 4, 5 and 9. 

She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns extra income from her kiosk business. 

She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business and be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 KES to buy a blow dry machine.

loans.use: To  buy a blow dry machine.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 27 years old, married to Yusuf and they have one child. 

She sells clothes and she has been in business for five years, earning a monthly income from the business of KES 20,000.

She is borrowing her first loan from KADET Ltd. of KES 20,000. She will use the funds to add more stock,  i.e new clothes, Muslim female clothing, gear  and scarves. She plans to open another business with the anticipated profit. 

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and diversify to other businesses.

loans.use: To add more stock to the business.

loans.name: Maritinah

texts.en:
Maritinah is 42 years old, married, and has three children, age 11, 14 and 18. 

She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years. She earns extra income from her husband's employment. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to educate her children. 

She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 KES to buy cooking fat and milk.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar is 30 years old. She could not continue her studies when she was younger, but she kept her goal of getting a collage education in her mind until now. Today Intisar is a second-year student at Applied University in Jordan, studying to get her diploma degree. In the future she would like to work in the banking field.
To be able to continue her studies, Intisar has applied for a loan to pay her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old, married, and has four children, age 23, 25, 29 and 30. 

She does dairy farming to earn a living and has been in the business for six years. She earns extra income from her shop. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able expand her business. She hopes to expand her business and be financially secure in the future. She has applied for 60,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is 25 years old and married. She has three children. 

She sells food, such as tea and cooked rice, to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. 

She describes her business environment as good because she has regular customers. Her other source of income is from her farming activities. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 70,000 KES to buy maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and medicines.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah, 34 years old, is married and has three children aged 4, 8 and 12. He has been selling charcoal to earn a living for four years and employs one person. Noah's other source of income is farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Noah has been able to save his income. He hopes to expand his business to wholesale in the future. Noah has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To  buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables, onions and a fridge to store fresh fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize for sale

loans.name: Esther Akarm

texts.en:
Esther Akarm is a 52-year-old retail shop proprietor in Voi. She is a widowed mother of four. Esther Akarm has been running her shop for the past ten years with great success. 

This is Esther’s third loan from KADET. She plans to use it to purchase cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders for her stock. She will use the proceeds from her expanded business to buy land to build rental houses. Esther Akarm hopes to excel in her business and to have a happy, comfortable family.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Maweu

texts.en:
Maweu is 45 years old, married and has three children. He repairs shoes to earn a living. He has been in this business for 14 years. Maweu describes his business environment as good because of limited competition. 
Since Maweu joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya he has been able to educate his children. In the future, he hopes to open a shoe shop and be financially stable. Maweu has applied for a loan of 70,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sewing thread and shoe soles.

loans.use: to buy sewing thread and shoe soles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and travelling bags.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 34 years old, married and has three children aged six, eight and ten. She sells bags, shoes and dresses to earn a living. Ruth has been in this business for three years and employs one person. Her other source of income is from farming activities. 
Since Ruth joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya she has been able to save some income. She hopes to open a boutique and be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more bags for resale.

loans.use: to buy more bags for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 33 years old, married and has four children aged 8, 10, 14 and 16. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. Lucy has been in this business for 10 years and employs one person. Her other source of income is from poultry farming. 
Since Lucy joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save some income. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a hairdryer and a blow dry machine.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and a blow dry machine.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 24 years old and has one child aged six. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. Esther has been in this business for four years and employs two people. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. 
Since Esther joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards. She hopes to expand her business to wholesale in the future. She has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a hairdryer and a blow dry machine.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and a blow dry machine.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 45 years old, married to Beatrice and has seven children. He repairs and sells used radiators and has been in this business for ten years. He earns a monthly income from the business of 8,000 KES.
Patrick is requesting his first loan of 20,000 KES, which he plans to use to purchase used radiators to repair and sell. He will repay the loan with the anticipated profit and save some of it. His hope and dream is to expand his business to a level where he can employ other people.

loans.use: to purchase used radiators.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 26, is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past three years, Fatuma has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and employing more people. 
With her loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a beauty shop and sells hairspray, lotion, and nail polish to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years and employs one person. 

Eunice  is requesting a loan for 90,000 KES, which she will use to buy hairspray, lotion, and nail polish. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people are in the same business. She hopes to expand her business to wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hairspray, lotion, and nail polish.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy, 29 years old, is married and has two children aged 6 and 12. She owns a green grocery store where she sells sweet potatoes, carrots and vegetables to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years. Her other source of income is from farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Lucy has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business to wholesale in the future. Lucy has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy sweet potatoes, carrots and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy sweet potatoes, carrots and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for making cushion covers

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en: Felistus is 38 years old, single, and has one child. She owns a general shop, which has been in business for two years. She describes her business environment as busy due to many customers who visit her daily. She also describes herself as hardworking. She hopes to expand her business to wholesale in the future. She has applied for 20,000 KES to buy six bundles of maize flour, one sack of sugar, and beans.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar, and beans for resale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 29 years old, married, with two children. She sells phones and accessories. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as good because there is little competition. 

Since she joined she has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her shop into a wholesale shop in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy phone chargers and batteries.

loans.use: To buy phone chargers and batteries.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 60 years old, married and has 3 children aged 8, 12 and 13. He does dairy farming to earn a living, and has been in the business for six years. He describes his business environment as favorable because his customers are regular. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to develop his business. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a cow and cow feed.

loans.use: To buy a cow and cow feed.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 24 year old single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as very determined. He provides transportation with his bicycle. He has been in this business for two years. He has both new and repeat customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as being inadequate funds for purchasing a motorbike. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to his savings and buy a motorbike. His business goal is to own quite a number of motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: To add to his savings to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Francoise Yvette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 22 et 26 ans,elle commence avec la vente des produits divers il ya de cela 10 ans,elle est bénéficiaire de Hope depuis bientôt 10 années, elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine et des pagnes.
Elle a des recettes qui ont augmentés de 20.000 frs a 50.000 frs  le jour , et fait des benefices considérables depuis l'obtention des prêts.Son commerce a beaucoup évolué , avec son quatrième prêt, elle va renforcer le stock des marchandises , ajouter des pagnes de differents qualité comme le réal, les Hi target, le wax et cuvettes, des bassines , des seaux, des marmites et des pots.
Elle a pour ambition d'être  grossiste des pagnes et faire un dépôt des ustensiles en plastiques qu'elle ira acheter a Kinshasa.
Pour sa famille , elle est entrain de construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
She is a 48 year old client who is unmarried and has 2 children between the ages of 22 and 26 .She started selling various products about 10 years ago, she has been  a Hope beneficiary   for about 10 years and she sells kitchen utensils and fabrics.
Her takings have increased by about 20,000 Frs. to 50,000 Frs. per day and she has been making considerable profits since she obtained her loans. Her business has progressed a lot, with her fourth loan, she intends to increase her stock, add fabrics of different qualities like the real wax, Hi target wax, textiles, bowls, basins, buckets, saucepans, and jugs.
Her ambition is to become a fabric wholesaler and hold a depot of plastic utensils that she will purchase in Kinshasa.
For her family she is in the process of building a house for her children.

loans.use: To purchase cooking utensils,saucepans,buckets,plastic jugsand traditional cloth.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is a 28 year old single woman.  She has no children yet. She describes herself as ambitious. She runs a restaurant where she sells tea, food, sodas etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. She has both repeat and new customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as being inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy flour, baking powder and pay new employees. Her business goal is to expand her restaurant by having many customers within five years.

loans.use: To buy more flour and baking powder, and pay new employees.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es: El Sr. Aquiles vive en casa familiar, de los papás de la cónyuge, no tienen hijos todavía, pero en un futuro desea tener hijos, la actividad principal es el Internet, tienen un café internet que ambos atienden, y donde les va muy bien,  el internet es en el mismo domicilio. El crédito lo invertirán en mejorar y refaccionar otro ambiente para su internet ya que por la mucha clientela le quedo chico y desea ampliar su negocio, el se siente feliz ya que gracias al apoyo de la institución crecerá su negocio, y mejora su calidad de vida, ya que esta es su única fuente de ingreso para la familia, el es un joven emprendedor con ganas de superación que con el tiempo desea poder abrir otra sucursal de su negocio.
texts.en:
Aquiles lives in the home of his in-laws. He and his wife don't have children yet, but they wish to have children in the future. His principal activity is the internet; he has an internet cafe that he and his wife attend to, and it is going very well. The internet cafe is located in their domicile.

The loan will be invested in improving and furnishing an additional room for their internet cafe, since given the present number of customers, the space seems too small and Aquiles wants to expand the business. He is happy since, thanks to our institution's help, he can expand the business and improve his family's quality of life. This is their only source of income. Aquiles is an enterprising youth with the desire to get ahead. In time, he wants to open another branch of his business.

loans.use: refurbish and improve an added room for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat, 27 years old, is married and has a nine-year-old daughter. He describes himself as a courageous man. He has been selling items such as tea leaves, sugar, salt, doughnuts, lamps etc for the last three years. His business challenge is insufficient funds to expand the business. 

He will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more doughnuts, sugar, tea leaves, lamps, etc. In the next five years, Josphat hopes to run more such general stores.

loans.use: To buy more doughnuts, sugar, tea leaves, lamps, etc.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel de 41 años, convive con Rebeca, su pareja, con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo 2 están en su poder, por estar en la escuela y el colegio. Esta familia vive en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Yurinaki. Miguel es un hombre próspero. Posee 7 cuadras de terrenos agrícolas, en ellos siembra café y plátanos. Desde que se unió con su pareja se dedica con más fuerza a esta actividad ya que, nacieron sus hijos y son ellos su inspiración. Ahora solo mantienen a 2 de ellos y la vida se les ha hecho más llevadera. Su preocupación se centra más en sus cultivos. “Tenemos que luchar contra la Pienera (enfermedad que quema las hojas de café), para eso usamos cal, que es lo más sano para el cafetal”, dice.
A él le gusta su trabajo. Con su trabajo sacrificado logra obtener de 48 a 50 sacos de café y de 60 a 70 arrobas de plátanos cada quince días. Está contento. Siente que le falta mucho por lograr, especialmente educar adecuadamente a sus hijos. Espera verlos convertidos en personas responsables y sobresalientes. Es por eso que seguirá trabajando la tierra con el mismo ahínco que siempre. Sería la primera vez que Miguel obtendría un crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los productores Yaneshas”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, muestra interés y ganas de trabajar en grupo. De recibir el dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus tierras de café y plátanos.
texts.en:
Miguel, who is 41 years old, lives with his partner Rebeca.  They have 5 children, but only 2 are in their care; they are school-aged.  This family lives in the rural community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki in Perené District, Yurinaki Province.  Miguel is a prosperous man.  He has 7 blocks of agricultural land on which he plants coffee and bananas.  Since he got together with his partner, he has dedicated himself even more to his business.  When his children were born, they became his motivation.  Now, he only supports 2 of his children and life has become easier.  His concerns are now centered on his crops.  "We have to fight against Pienera (a disease that burns the coffee leaves), for which we use lime.  It is the healthiest for the coffee plant," he says.
Miguel likes his work.  With his selfless work, he is able to get 48 to 50 sacs of coffee and 60 to 70 arrobas (a unit of weight comparable to 24-36 lbs. per arroba) of bananas every two weeks.  Miguel is happy.  He feels that he still has a lot to achieve, especially giving his children an decent education.  He hopes to see them grow into responsible, successful adults.  That is why he will keep working the land with the same diligence as always.  This is the first time that Miguel is getting a loan from MFP, and so he promises to be timely in the repayment of his loan.  “Los productores Yaneshas” is the name of his communal bank.  Miguel has shown an interest and desire to work with the group.  Once he receives the money, he will be able to purchase bags of organic fertilizer to fertilize his coffee and banana crops.

loans.use: to purchase bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Ana, sigue aumentando su negocio, al introducir mas mercaderia, vive junto a su esposo, quien sigue laborando como docente, sus hijos  trabajan y le aportan economicamente.
Hoy con esta nueva inversion, comprara: frijoles, arroz, azucar, vidon de aceite, productos lacteos, productos de la coca cola, golosinas entre otros productos. Con esto aumenta sus ventas y ganancias para lograr pagar los gastos basicos del hogar, y poder cubrir los gastos personales.
texts.en:
Ana continues increasing her business introducing more merchandise.  She lives with her husband who continues working as a teacher; her children work and contribute economically.

With this new investment, she will buy: beans, rice, sugar, large jugs of oil, dairy products, Coca-Cola products and snacks, among other products.  With this, sales and profits will increase so that she can pay for her household’s basic needs and cover her personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socrro es una joven de 27 años de edad, muy creativa y luchadora, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, Ica,  conocida como “ la tierra del sol Eterno”, ya que siempre se puede disfrutar del sol en cualquier época del año, asimismo también por sus danzas típicas y por la “Laguna de Huacachina” conocida como  “el oasis de América” y sobre todo porque es una ciudad donde los pobladores son muy hospitalarios y generosos, además de ser optimistas ya que a pesar del terremoto sucedido en el año 2007 en el cual muchos pobladores perdieron la vida y quedaron damnificados, los pobladores salieron adelante. A Socorro disfrutar en sus tiempo libre ( que son muy pocos), viendo películas en casa, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos suficientes y es por ello que socorro aprendió lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente desde pequeña ya que ella trabajaba para apoyar a sus padres en casa.

Socorro se dedica actualmente a la elaboración de Tortas( pasteles) y a la decoración de ambientes para fiestas (matrimonios, bautizos, primera comunión, etc.) ella es responsable y muy creativa, le dedica  al trabajo alrededor de 6 horas por trabajo, en algunas oportunidades puede atender a 1 cliente al día pero a veces puede atender hasta 5 clientes y ella nos comenta que se convierte en la mujer elástica para poder cumplir con todos y sobre todo para entregar un trabajo impecable, en un dia puede ganar hasta S/. 250 pero en un dia muy bueno S/. 350, ella cree que le va muy bien porque brinda un buen servicio, es puntual en la entrega de sus trabajos y no cobra mucho por eso que sus clientes la recomiendan.

Socorro está muy agradecida y feliz con el apoyo de los prestatarios Kiva, ya que con esta ayuda ella podrá comprar más insumos para la elaboracion de sus tortas asi como tambien materiales como sillas y telas para elaboración de sus decoraciones, así como los pisos pedestales para sus tortas, con esta mejora ella tendrá mas material para realizar sus decoraciones y brindarle más variedad a sus clientes con ello tendrá mas ingresos y podrá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su sueño más grande:” Tener su Casa Propia”
texts.en:
Socorro, 27, is very creative and tenacious.  She lives in the city of Ica, known as the “City of the Eternal Sun” because sunshine can be enjoyed year-round.  It’s also known for its traditional dances and for the Huacachina Lagoon also known as “America’s Oasis” but, above all, because it’s a city whose residents are very hospitable and generous besides being optimistic because despite the 2007 earthquake, where many residents lost their lives and suffered damages, the residents rose above and continued forward.

Socorro likes to enjoy her free time (which is very little) watching movies at home.  She attended school up to fifth year of secondary school but because her parents did not have sufficient economic resources Socorro learned to earn her livelihood with the sweat from her brow and since she was a little girl she’s worked to help her parents at home.

Socorro currently works making Tortas (cakes) and decorating spaces for parties (weddings, baptisms, first communions, etc.). She is very responsible and very creative.  She spends about 6 hours on each job and sometimes might have just one customer in a day but other times could have up to five and she comments that she becomes an elastic woman to do everything and turn in impeccable work each time.  She can earn up to 250 soles on a day but on a very good day up to 350 soles.  She believes that she does so well because she provides a good service, she turns in her jobs on time and she does not charge a lot; this is why her customers recommend her to others.

Socorro is very grateful and happy with the support from Kiva lenders because with it she’ll be able to buy more ingredients for her cakes as well as supplies like chairs and fabric to make her decorations; she’ll also buy cake stands for her cakes.  With this improvement she’ll have more materials to make her decorations and provide more variety to her customers which will lead to more income so that she can continue to save up to reach her greatest dream: “To have a house of her own.”

loans.use: to buy chairs and fabric.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Esperanza es soltera no tiene hijos, ella es de origen humilde y sencilla, tiene una hermana quien es casada y tiene un niño de 3 años, La Sra. esperanza ambas son huérfanas desde muy pequeñas.       Esperanza vive en la localidad de Sacaba, en la zona Canal Pata, la señora Esperanza se dedica al comercio de fierro es decir, punta, cinceles, pata y carba y grifa. Ella se dedica mas de 2 años al negocio de fierro, con el dinero del crédito comprara  fierro por cantidad,  ella compra en Cochabamba, y lo vende en la ciudad de santa cruz, viaja dos veces a la semana a vender sus productos,  es un  apersona joven y trabajadora que desde muy niña empezó a trabajar, tiene  muchas ganas de superación y se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para mantenerse.
texts.en: Esperanza is single and has no children.  She has humble, unassuming origins.  She has a married sister who has a 3-year-old boy.  Esperanza and her sister were orphaned while still very little.  Esperanza lives in Sacaba in the Canal Pata zone.  She is a metal merchant, that is, various metal tools like nail, chisels, wrenches, crowbars and others.  She’s been in the metal business for more than two years.  She will use the loan money to buy metal in quantity.  She buys in Cochabamba and sells in Santa Cruz.  She travels twice a week to sell her products.  She’s still a young, hardworking person who started working while still a girl.  She very much wants to get ahead and feels happy about the opportunity she’s being given since this is her only source of income to support herself.

loans.use: to buy metal.

loans.name: Veronica Del Socorro

texts.es: Verónica es una emprendedora que se le ha brindado apoyo con el financiamiento su negocio a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Verónica  como toda madre busca el bienestar de sus hijos dándole lo mejor. Verónica ha demostrado ser una persona honesta y responsable y con ganas de superación. Verónica actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de mercadería en general como ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y cosméticos entre otros productos que más demandan.
texts.en: Verónica is an entrepreneur who has availed herself of support with financing.  The business she’s in is general merchandise sales.  Verónica, like all good mothers, seeks her children’s wellbeing providing the best for them.  Verónica has shown herself to be an honest, responsible person who wants to get ahead.  She is currently asking for a loan to invest in her business buying general merchandise like clothes for women, men and children and cosmetics among other products she is asked for.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Ms. Hue is 24 years old with one small child.  Being  a hair dresser, she opened a  small hair salon  in 2008.  Every month, she  earns 2,500,000 Vietnam dong from this shop.  Joining our credit program in 2009, she has used loans  to buy some hair machines to make curls and other hair cutting tools. She also has improved this shop to make it more professional.  

For new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy hair care products to meet the  demand  on the Tet holiday.

loans.use: to buy hair care products to meet the  demand  on the Tet holiday.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando de 53 años es un hombre viudo, Tiene 2 hijos que ya lo hicieron abuelo. Él vive en su casa propia con su hija y su nieta en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Rolando es agricultor. Desde niño aprendió estas labores ayudando a sus padres en el campo. Ahora que el tiempo ha pasado su experiencia se ve reflejado en la producción y ganancias que su actividad le genera. En sus 3 cuadras de terrenos cultiva café, plátanos y yucas; obteniendo buenos ingresos para su familia.
Sus cosechas las expende en las ciudades de Yurinaki y Pichanaki.
Al mismo tiempo se dedica a otro negocio, que es la crianza de mariposas, para eso recibe el asesoramiento de una empresa. “Criamos mariposas para velar por su preservación, por eso me gusta esta labor”, dice.
Rolando ya es un hombre mayor pero no se queja de su trabajo, para avanzar y evitarse fatigas contrata personal. Así limpia y cosecha el café y no descuida sus ventas.
Aún tiene motivos por los que trabajar y son sus hijos y nietos, por eso seguirá cogiendo las herramientas del campo. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, que recibiría gracias a su apoyo. Por eso muestra firmeza al mencionar que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los Productores Yaneshas”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que se siente contento. Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar 8 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de café, plátanos y yucas.
texts.en:
Rolando, 53, is a widower.  He has two children who have already made him a grandfather.  He lives in his own house with his daughter and granddaughter in the indigenous community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki in Chanchamayo Province.  Rolando is a farmer.  He learned this occupation while still a young boy helping his parents in the fields.  Now that time has passed his experience is reflected in production and profits that his activity generates.  He grows coffee, banana and cassava on his 3 cuadras [unit of land measurement] of land obtaining good income for his family.  He sells his harvests in the cities of Yurinaki and Pichanaki.

At the same time he has another business which is raising butterflies and for this he gets advice from a firm.  “We raise butterflies in order to watch over their conservation and this is why I like this work,” he says.

Rolando is already an older man but he does not complain about his work.  To get ahead and avoid becoming exhausted he hires workers; this is how he cleans and harvests the coffee and does not neglect his sales.

He still has reasons to work: his children and grandchildren.  Because of this he continues to wield the work tools.  This will be his first MFP loan that he’ll get thanks to your support so he is firm in mentioning that he will be punctual with his installment payments.  “Los Productores Yaneshas” (Yanesha Producers) is the name of his communal bank that he’s very happy about.  With the money from the loan he will be able to buy 8 sacks of organic manure for his coffee, banana and cassava crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN COPACABANA DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aquilina; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de jugos, ella vende jugo de naranja, jugo de papaya, jugo de plátano entre otros jugos, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, yeso y pintura.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Aquilina, 46, belongs to the “Virgen Copacabana de Ollantaytambo” communal bank located in Ollantaytambo District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling juices.  She sells orange, papaya and banana juice among others.  Through these small businesses she supports her children.  Her dream is to finish building her house.  She is asking for the loan to buy building materials like cement, sand, plaster and paint.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Ms.  Quy  is 62 years old with three children who are   grown.  As a farmer, she grows rice and raises pigs.  Participating in our credit program, she has used loans for improving her pigpen and  buying daily feed for the pigs. She is now expanding her business.  Therefore, she wants to borrow  a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy feed for her pigs

loans.use: to buy feed for  pigs.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam de 44 años es una mujer casada con José. Con él tiene 5 hijos de 22, 17, 13, 10 y 2 años. Pero solo vive con los 4 menores en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Miriam es una madre y esposa ejemplar. Se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo atrás a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus familiares y comuneros de la zona. 
Es así que cuenta con 7 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas. En ellos siembra café, plátanos y yuca, en las mismas cantidades, así asegura sus ingresos por ambas partes. “Sembrar café y plátanos es más rentable en esta zona por su demanda, y nunca hay pierde”, comenta.
Miriam está contenta por la variedad de plátanos que produce: Canelita, Bizcochito y Seda. A eso se debe también la rapidez de sus ventas. El motivo de su esfuerzo son sus hijos, por ellos no duda en coger el machete y dirigirse a los montes donde se ubican sus terrenos para limpiarlos.
Mas adelante le gustaría, aumentar su producción con la adquisición de más terrenos. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Miriam obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se muestra esperanzada.
Sin dudarlo invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de café, ya que tienen que estar listos para los meses de mayo y junio.
texts.en:
Miriam, 44, is married to José.  She has five children with him who are 22, 17, 13, 10 and 2 years old but she only lives with the four youngest ones in her own house in the indigenous community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki, Chanchamayo Province.  Miriam is an exemplary mother and wife.  For a long time she’s been farming, an activity she learned from her family and from local communal land owners.

She has seven parcels of land, then, where she grows coffee, bananas and cassava in equal amounts thus insuring income from each part.  “Planting coffee and bananas is more profitable in this zone because of demand so that’s always a sure thing,“ she comments.

Miriam is happy with the assortment of bananas she produces: Canelita, Bizcochito and Seda.  This too leads to quick sales.  Her children are the motivators of her efforts.  For them, she does not hesitate to pick up a machete and head into the hills where her parcels are located to clear them.

Later on she’d like to increase production by acquiring more land.  This would be Miriam’s first MFP loan and she’s very excited about it.  She is now part of the “Los Productores Yaneshas” (Yanesha Producers) communal bank and she’s very hopeful about it.  

Without a doubt, she will use the money from the loan to buy ten sacks of organic manure for her coffee crops because they have to be ready for the months of May and June.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Ms. Chin is 40 years old with two children who are   grown.  As a farmer, she grows rice and pigs.  Participating in our credit program, she has used loans for improving her pigpen and  buying daily feed for them. She is now expanding her business.  Therefore, she wants to take out  a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy feed for  pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for  pigs.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Ms. Mai is 37 years old with  three children. Two of them are attending high school. The other is small.  Being a farmer, she grows rice to cover her family's food needs and also for pig feed. Her  business is developing well. This year she got food revenue from this activity.  Taking part in our credit program since 2009,   she has used loans to  buy fertilizer and seeds.   For this new loan cycle, she  requires a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy feed for pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo de 26 años, convive con Mari, la madre de sus 2 hijos: Gaby de 6 años y Michez de 2. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Arturo se dedica a la agricultura. En los terrenos de cultivos que sus padres y la comunidad les ha asignado siembra: café, plátanos y maíz. Estos 3 productos son rentables, depende como él los negocie y trabaje. Pero se centra más en el cultivo de café. En una parcela entera tiene sembrados éstos granos tan demandados por los compradores.
Tiene que abonar sus plantas cada 6 meses, para asegurar su crecimiento y formación de los granos. 
Aparte de vender los granos secos, también los vende molidos y embolsados. Esta actividad inicia en el mes de enero. Sus compradores son personas que vienen de visita hacia su comunidad y se llevan bolsas de café listas para consumir. Arturo es emprendedor. Es así que ahora piensa extender sus sembríos sembrando más café, de esa manera podrá darle a su familia la calidad de vida necesaria. Sería la primera vez que Arturo recibiría un préstamo de MFP, por eso muestra firmeza al mencionar que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los productores Yaneshas”, es su reciente banco comunal, siente que en grupo sus logros serán mayores. Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar 10 bolsas de abonos para fertilizar las tierras del café. Así asegurará una buena cosecha para junio y julio.
texts.en:
Arturo, 26, lives with Mari, the mother of his two children: Gaby, 6 and Michez, 2. This family lives in their own house in the indigenous community of Villa María in Chanchamayo Province.  Arturo is a farmer.  On his parents’ land and on land assigned to him by the community he grows coffee, bananas and corn.  These three products are profitable depending on how he negotiates and works them.  But he concentrates on coffee production the most.  He has an entire parcel planted with these beans that are in such high demand by buyers.  He has to fertilize his plants every six months to insure their growth and the formation of the coffee beans.

Besides selling dry beans, he also sells them ground and bagged.  This activity starts in the month of January.  His buyers are people who come to visit his community and take bags of ready to be consumed coffee.  Arturo is an entrepreneur and is thinking about extending his fields planting more coffee to give his family the necessary quality of life.  

This will be Arturo’s first MFP loan and he’s firm in mentioning that he will be punctual with his installment payments.  His communal bank is called “Los Productores Yaneshas” (Yaneshas Producers) and he believes that his accomplishments will be greater in the group.  He will use the money from the loan to buy 10 sacks of organic manure to fertilize his coffee fields thus insuring a good harvest in June and July.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: An

texts.en: Ms. An, 33 years old, has 2 school-aged children. She is a vegetable retailer.  Everyday, she goes to the wholesale market to buy fresh vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, etc. and then sells them at the local market. She started the business 1 year ago and it creates considerable income for her to manage family life and pay for school fees. Ms. An wants a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy more fresh vegetables to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es: Marcela es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” grupo que está conformado por 07 socios responsables y trabajadores, siendo Marcela la que preside al grupo. Ella tiene 42 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos que aún sigue apoyando. Con los deseos de superarse inicio su propio negocio, la cual realiza manualidades como bordado en cinta, repujado de aluminio, pintado en vidrio, entre otros la cual trabaja sobre pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, este negocio le ha beneficiado, pues nos cuenta que con los conocimientos adquiridos,  también brinda clases de manualidades, de donde obtiene un ingreso extra para su hogar. Gracias a este negocio a podido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. A fin de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito para la compra de cintas, telas, pinturas, aluminios y pinceles y así poder elaborar sus manualidades. El deseo de Marcela es habilitar un espacio en su domicilio donde pueda exhibir sus trabajos manuales. La Alcancía Comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Marcela es la que  está ubicada al medio de su grupo, ella viste una bruza blanca con flores estampadas. En la foto grupal adjuntamos la fotografía de Yemima.
texts.en:
Marcela’s a member of the “Uniendo Fuerzas” (Uniting Strength) communal bank which has 7 responsible, hardworking members; Marcela is group President.  She’s 42 years old, separated and has two children that she still supports.  With the wish to improve she started her own business making crafts like ribbon embroidery, aluminum embossing, painting on glass, among others.  She works based on prior customer orders.  The business has benefitted her because she tells us that with the skills learned she also teaches crafts classes thus earning extra household income.  Thanks to this business she’s been able to improve her family’s quality of life.

In order to continue improving, she’s asked for a loan to buy ribbon, fabric, paint, aluminum and brushes to make her crafts.  Marcela’s wish is to equip a space at home where she can display her manual arts.

The “Uniendo Fuerzas” communal bank is grateful for the loan granted and commits to continue working well.  Marcela appears in the center of the group wearing a white blouse printed with flowers.  We have inserted Yemima’s photo in the group photo.

loans.use: to buy ribbon, fabric, paint, aluminum and brushes.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio de 31 años convive con Janeth, su pareja, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año de edad. Ellos viven bajo un techo propio en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Julio es un esposo y padre ejemplar. Todo su esfuerzo tiene como motor su familia. 
Desde pequeño aprendió las labores del campo, es así que inició con sus propios sembríos en parcelas de terrenos que su comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron. 
De esa manera ha podido surtir y equilibrar su producción. Él cultiva café, yuca y plátano.
“De mi parcela de plátanos obtengo como de 20 a 30 arrobas, cada arroba está  a 4 soles. Si me conviene”, menciona.  Por su parte la siembra de café es aún más rentable, de sus chacras cosecha 40 sacos, cuyas ventas las realiza en abril y junio.
Julio quiere ampliar sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Con eso quiere darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa. Ésta sería la primera vez que Julio obtendría un crédito de MFP, por tal razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente emocionado por ser parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”. De recibir el dinero podrá comprar 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos de 110 soles cada uno. Con esto estará fertilizando sus tierras, ya que tiene que hacerlo 2 veces al año para asegurar una buena producción.
texts.en:
Julio, 31, lives with Janeth, his spouse, with whom he has three children who are 6, 4 and 1 year old.  They live beneath their own roof in the indigenous community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki in Chanchamayo Province.  Julio is an exemplary husband and father.  All of his efforts are motivated by his family.

Since he was little he learned farming tasks and this is how he started out with his own parcels of land that his community and his parents assigned him.  He has been able to vary and balance his production.  He grows coffee, manioc and bananas.

“From my parcel of bananas I obtain about 20 to 30 arrobas [1 arroba = 11.5 kilos] and each arroba sells for 4 soles.  This is to my advantage,” he mentions.  The coffee is even more profitable.  He harvests 40 sacks from his fields that he sells in April and June.

Julio wants to expand his fields and increase production to provide better conditions for his wife and children.  This will be the first time that Julio gets an MFP loan so he gives his word that he will be punctual with the installment payments.  He feels excited to belong to the “Los Productores Yaneshas” communal bank.

If he were to receive the money, he will be able to buy 10 sacks of organic manure that cost 110 soles each.  With this he will be fertilizing his land because he has to do this twice a year to insure a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of organic manure.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Ms Thuan is 55 years old with two grown children.  She is a retailer.  Her business focuses on selling bamboo carpets that are used for construction. Every month, she earns 3,500,000 Vietnam dong from this.  Participating in the credit programme since 2009, she has used loans effectively in expanding her business.  Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy more bamboo carpets to sale

loans.use: to buy more bamboo carpets to sell.

loans.name: Nesida

texts.es:
Nesida de 21 años, convive con Elder, con quien tiene a su única hija, Jhazlith. Esta pequeña pero unida familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Villa María Alto Yurinaki, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Nesida se dedica a la agricultura. Ella y Elder trabajan en las 2 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas donde siembran café y plátanos. Ellos priorizan estos 2 productos por que el plátanos se cosecha cada quince días y su venta es inmediata, obteniendo ingresos para el día a día. El café es más rentable pero su producción es anual, permitiéndoles ahorrar y volver a invertir en próximas cosechas.
“Mis chacras de café botan como 50 latas de café, cada lata está ahora a 85 soles, pero hay días en que sube hasta 110 soles”, menciona. Así como hay días prósperos, también hay temporadas en que el precio baja hasta 40 soles la lata. Es por eso que hacen lo posible para cosechar en los meses de mayo, junio y julio, que son los más favorables.
Siempre necesitan el apoyo de jornaleros para trabajar sus tierras, para eso también que invertir en los pagos diarios. Nesida tiene como metas ampliar sus sembríos y más adelante abrir una pequeña bodega. Éste sería su primer préstamo que obtendría gracias a su ayuda de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Acaba de formar parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se siente contenta y emocionada por el trabajo en grupos.
Con el dinero podrá contratar el personal necesario para hacer trabajar sus tierras. Pagará de 25 a 30 soles al día por jornaleros.
texts.en:
Nesida is 21, and lives with her partner Elder, with whom she has her only daughter, Jhazlith. This small but close-knit family lives in their own house in the native community of Villa Maria Alto Yurinaki, in Chinchamayo province. Nesida is a farmer. She and Elder work on two parcels of agricultural land, where they grow coffee and plantains. 

They give priority to these two products, because the plantains are harvested every two weeks, and are sold immediately, obtaining income for day to day needs. Coffee is more profitable, but it produces on an annual basis, allowing them to save and invest again in the next harvest.

"My coffee plantation produces around 50 baskets of coffee. every basket is now worth 85 soles, but there are days when it rises to 110 soles", she says. Just as there are prosperous days, there are also times of the the year when the price goes down to 40 soles a basket. 

That's why they do their best to harvest in the months of May, June and July, which are the most favorable. They always need the help of day laborers to work their land. For that, they have to make daily payments. Nesida has as her goal expanding her plantings, and later on opening a small convenience store. 

This would be her first loan obtained thanks to MFP's help. That's why she is committing to be on time in paying her monthly instalments. She has just joined the "Los Productores Yaneshas" communal bank, and she is happy with it, and excited about the group work. 

With the money, she will be able to hire the people she needs to have her land worked.  She will pay from 25 to 30 soles a day for day laborers.

loans.use: To hire day laborers.

loans.name: Quynh's Group

texts.en:
Ms Quynh is twenty-seven years old with two small children.  She runs a shop selling shirts and trousers.  Her business started one year ago after she  stopped operating her grocery shop.  

She joined the credit program in 2010, and has used loans to buy products.  For the new loans cycle, she wants to borrow a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to buy more newly designed clothes to sell.

Loc is fifty-one years old.  She runs a shop selling drinks.  She wants to borrow a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to buy more drinking water to sell.

loans.use: to buy more newly designed clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 58 años está casado con Juana, con ella tuvo a sus 8 hijos. Ahora solo vive con Beto de 12 años, que es el menor de todos. Martín tiene una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Carlos es un hombre ejemplar. Con su trabajo dedicado en la agricultura ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, y brindarles una educación digna a sus hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y por quienes trabaja. Desde niño aprendió a labrar la tierra y negociar los productos que le otorga la naturaleza. En los montes de su comunidad cuenta con 3 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos, en los que produce café.
Alfonso está contento con sus resultados, de las 3 parcelas obtiene como 15 sacos de café de 60 kilos cada uno aproximadamente.
A la vez, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados Brown Swiis.  “Compro terneras a 1200 soles y cuando las engordó las vendo a 2000 soles. Si es rentable.” Comenta. 
Carlos quiere ampliar su negocio de ganados pero sin descuidar sus cultivos. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Carlos obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionado por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se muestra esperanzado. De recibir el dinero, comprará bolsas de abonos para sus sembríos de café. Y con lo restante completará el dinero necesario para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 58, and married to Juana. With her, he had his eight children. Now he only lives with Beto, 12, who is the youngest of all. Martin has his own house in the native community of Villa Maria Alto Yurinaki, in Chinchamayo province. 

Carlos is an exemplary man. With his dedicated work as a farmer, he has been able to raise his family, and provide a decent education for his children, whom he loves very much, and for whom he works.

He learned to work the land as a child, and sell the products that nature grants him. In the hills near his community, he has three parcels of cropland, where he produces coffee.

Carlos is happy about his results. From the three parcels, he gets around 15 sacks of coffee of approximately 60 kilos each. 

At the same time, he buys and sells Brown Swiss cattle. "I buy calves at 1200 soles, and when I have fattened them, I sell them for 2000 soles, so yes, it is profitable," he says. 

Carlos wants to expand his livestock business, but without neglecting his crops. This would be the first loan that Carlos that has obtained from MFP. He is excited about this. Now he is part of the "Los Productores Yaneshas" communal bank, which he has high hopes for. 

On receiving the money, he will buy bags of fertilizer for his coffee plantings. With what's left over, he will have the money he needs to finish building his house.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer, and materials for building his house.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es: El señor Abelardo es Albañil. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima (ladrillos, cemento, piedra, arena, madera y calamina) para la construcción de una habitación en su vivienda. Abelardo  es casado y tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Alto Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que trabaja con kiva y con IMPRO.
texts.en:
Abelardo is a bricklayer.  The loan that he needs is to buy raw material (bricks, cement, stone, sand, wood, and corrugated iron) to build a room in his house.

Abelardo is married and has two children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Alto Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that he has worked with Kiva and with IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy materials like bricks, cement, stone, sand, wood, and corrugated iron to build a room.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es: La señora Rogelia es una persona emprendedora y responsable se dedica a la venta de dulces y artículos de higiene personal  hace 2 años, su puesto se encuentra en un a avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad de Cochabamba vive en casa familiar ubicada en la zona sud de la ciudad tiene 4 hijos  que algunos se encuentran estudiando y otros son pequeños, su esposo es transportista publico el crédito que solicita es para comprar mercadería en variedad de dulces y  hacer crecer su capital de trabajo ya que estas fechas es donde mas demanda tiene, La Sra. Rogelia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite crecer en su negocio y también mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelia is an enterprsing and responsible person who has been selling candy and personal hygiene items for two years. Her stand is located on a very busy avenue in the city of Cochabamba. 

She lives in the family home, located in southern area of the city. She has four children; some are in school, and others are small. Her husband is a bus driver.  

She is applying for the loan in order to buy a variety of candy for sale, and to increase her working capital, as this is the time of year when there is more demand. 

Rogelia is a very hard-working person. She is happy about the support she has been offered, as this allows her to build her business, and also improve the quality of life for her entire family.

loans.use: To buy candy and general merchandise.

loans.name: Huyen's Group

texts.en:
Ms  Huyen is twenty years old with two small children.  She has a shop selling gas.  Her business started one year ago.  Seeing that it will develop more, she has used loans to buy more gas and sell gas cookers.  She joined the credit program in 2010 and she used her first loan effectively to expand her business.  Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to buy gas to invest in her gas shop.

Ms Chanh is fifty-three years old.  Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises pigs.  Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy gas to invest in her gas shop.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: Christian de 28 años convive con Mónica con quien tiene 2 hijos de 10 años y una pequeño de 2 meses de nacido. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Christian es un hombre de negocios y muy trabajador. Se dedica a la agricultura en sus 3 parcelas de terrenos siembra café, plátanos y yuca. En la zona de Villa María el plátano es muy solicitado por las bondades de sus tierras y climas. Es así que cada quincena Christian cosecha 20 arrobas, las que vende con éxito en la ciudad de Pichanaki. A él le gusta su trabajo, por ser más independiente y sobretodo porque sus ingresos dependen de su propio esfuerzo. Para agilizar su trabajo contrata personal que le ayuden a posear (acumular tierra alrededor de las plantas), desyerbar y sembrar sus cultivos, principalmente en el café.  Cuando tiene alguna urgencia económica, el plátano y las yucas siempre lo sacan de apuros, por ser quincenal, mientras que el café es anual. El piensa sembrar más productos para el próximo mes, para eso alquilará terrenos de vecinos o amigos. Sería la primera vez que Christian accedería a un préstamo de MFP. Se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contento de pertenecer al banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”. De obtener el dinero, podrá comprar bolsas de abonos para su cafetal y pagará los servicios de los jornaleros quienes apoyarán en la ardua labor.
texts.en:
Christian, 28 years old, lives with Monica with whom he has 2 children aged 10 years and 2 months. This family lives in their own house in Villa María Alto Yurinaki, an indigenous community in the Chanchamayo Province. 

Christian is a businessman and a very hard worker. He does agricultural work on his 3 parcels of land, growing coffee, plantains, and cassava. Plantains are much sought after in the region around Villa María due to its good soil and mild climate. So every two weeks Christian harvests 20 "arrobas" ["arroba" is a unit of measure equal to 24-36 pounds depending on the region], which he sells with great success in the city of Pichanaki. 

He likes his work because he is more independent and especially because his own efforts determine his income. To facilitate his work he hires personnel who help him to build up the soil around the plants, remove weeds, and plant his crops, mainly the coffee. When he finds himself in some economic tight spot, the plantain and cassava always get him through, since they are biweekly while the coffee is annual.  He wants to plant more produce for the next month, and to do so he will rent land from neighbors or friends. 

This will be the first loan that Christian has received from MFP. He takes responsibility for being punctual in making his payments. He is happy to belong to "Los Productores Yaneshas" communal bank. On obtaining the money, he will be able to purchase bags of fertilizer for his coffee plants and will pay for the services of the farm workers who will support him in the arduous work.

loans.use: to purchase bags of manure and to hire farm workers.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al ngeocio de venta de menestras pero no le fue bien en este negocio y ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de pescados y mariscos,ella vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local mas amplio donde pueda vender los pescados y mariscos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pescados y mariscos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia previously had a business selling stew, but this business did not do well and so now she is selling fish and seafood.  She sells in the market from 8am until 5pm, and through this business she provides for her children.  Alicia's dream is to have a bigger place to sell her fish and seafood.  She is requesting a loan to buy fish and seafood at wholesale.

Alicia is happy to be receiving this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy fish and seafood at wholesale

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El señor Yhonny es chofer propietario y esta actividad de transporte de pasajeros es la fuente de  ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia.  El crédito lo necesita para la compra de una caja de cambios para su movilidad, pues la actual está comenzando a fallar. Es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona  San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la tercera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Yhonny is a driver, and he has his own car.  This passenger transport business is the source of income that he has to support his family.

He needs the loan to buy a transmission for his vehicle because the one he has is starting to fail.

He has one child, and he rents where he lives in the San Martín zone in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time he has worked with IMPRO and the third time with Kiva.

loans.use: to replace the transmission in the vehicle that he uses for passenger transportation.

loans.name: Wuillson

texts.es:
Wuillson de 34 años convive hace 8 años con su pareja, con quien tiene una hija de 7 años llamada Alondra. Esta hermosa familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Wuillson es un esposo y padre ejemplar. Su rutina de trabajo empieza desde muy temprano.
Desde pequeño aprendió las labores del campo, es así que inició con sus propios sembríos en parcelas de terrenos que su comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron.  De esa manera ha podido surtir y equilibrar su producción. Él cultiva café, plátano y yuca. Así también trabaja como mecánico en un taller diariamente.
Y como si fuera poco él y su pareja han instalado un pequeño negocio de abarrotes en su propia casa. Así ambos se mantienen ocupados y obtienen ingresos de varias maneras. Wuillson quiere ampliar sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Con eso quiere darle mejores condiciones de vida a su hija y esposa. Esta sería la primera vez que Wuillson obtendría un préstamo de MFP gracias a su ayuda. Por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, se siente emocionado de ser parte del grupo.
De recibir el dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abonos para sus cultivos de café y surtir productos para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Wuillson, 34, lives with his partner and their 7 year old daughter, Alondra.  This lovely family lives in their own house in their native village Villa María Alto Yurinaki, Chanchamayo province.  Wuillson is an exemplary husband and father.  

His work day begins very early. He learned farming when he was very young and he started with his own fields offered him by his parents and his village.  This way he has been able to supply and balance his production.  He plants coffee, plantains and yucca and he also works every day as a mechanic in a shop.
And as if it were nothing he and his partner have also set up a small grocery business in their house.  This way they are both kept busy and earn incomes by various means.  Wuillson wants to increase the types of crops and production so that he can give his wife and daughter a better quality of life.  This is the first time, thanks to your help, that Wuillson will receive a loan from MFP.  He promises to be punctual in his payments.  He belongs to Los Productores Yaneshas communal bank and he is very excited to be part of this group.  He will use the money to buy sacks of fertilizer for his coffee plants and to stock his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo es chofer propietario de un taxi. El crédito lo necesita para la compra del motor de su vehiculo para continuar trabajando y mantener su nivel de ingresos. Es casado,  tiene tres  hijos y vive en anticretico  ubicada en la zona  San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz.  Es la décima cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO. Y la quinta vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a taxi driver, and he has his own car.  He needs the loan to buy a motor for his vehicle in order to continue working and maintaining his level of income.

He is married and has three children.  He lives in “anticretico” (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) in the San Martín zone in the city of La Paz.  

This is the 14th time he has worked with IMPRO and the fifth time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a 1600 c.c. motor for his taxi.

loans.name: Mirta Ximena

texts.es:
Mirta es una mujer de 35 años divorciada y madre de dos hijos que tienen 15 y 10 años. Juntos viven en la casa de su hermano en "Nanegalito" que es una parroquia de "San Miguel de Los Bancos" que es  pertenece a la provincia de Pichincha (donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador), toda la zona es visitada por sus cascadas, ríos y biodiversidad, el río Mulaute es un sitio de interés turístico, en el límite con la provincia de Santo Domingo, en varios tramos de estos ríos se practica el rafting. La comida típica es la guaña o campeche, que es un pescado que se consume estofado con plátano de tipo denominado orito verde. El ceviche de palmito, la tilapia, lomo a la piedra y el dulce de guayaba.

Mirta tiene un local donde vende desde caramelos hasta productos cosméticos desde hace tres años. Lo aprendió de sus amistades. La falta de oportunidades de crédito han sido sus mayores obstáculos, es por eso que Mirta ha acudido a Fundación Alternativa que es una institución que no sólo le brindará un crédito sino que le capacitará y le dará asistencia. Con este crédito esta mujer emprendedora espera mejorar es surtido de productos y así atraer mayor clientela y por ende tener mayores ingresos.

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con sus hijos. Y a pesar que el padre se sus hijos le ayuda económicamente la preocupación de Mirta está siempre con ella y por eso sueña con crecer como empresaria y así asegurar el porvenir de su familia.
texts.en:
Mirta is a 35-year-old divorced mother of two children ages 15 and 10. The all live in her brother's home in Nanegalito, a parish in San Miguel de Los Bancos, which is in the Pichincha province (where the capital of Ecuador is located). This area is frequented because of its waterfalls, rivers, and biodiversity. The Mulaute river is a tourist hotspot on the border of the Santo Domingo province. Rafting is done on various tributaries of this river. The traditional dish is guaña or campeche (fish that is stewed with green plantains), ceviche de palmito (palm hearts and raw fish marinated with citrus juices), tilapia, lomo a la piedra (steak cooked on a rock), and guava sweets. 
For three years, Mirta has been running a shop in which she sells anything from candy to cosmetics. Her lack of access to loans has been her biggest obstacle, which is why Mirta has turned to Fundación Alternativa, an institute that will not only provide her with a loan, but also train her and give her assistance. With this loan, the enterprising woman hopes to obtain a wider variety of products, thus bringing in more customers and in so doing, obtaining greater profits. 
Mirta likes to spend her free time with her children. Despite the fact that the father of her children helps her out financially, Mirta is always concerned about money, which is why she dreams of growing as an entrepreneur, thus ensuring a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Hawawu

texts.en: Hawawu has been selling eggs and frozen chicken in Esuekyir, near Abura, for 2 years. Hawawu is married to a mason and has 3 children. Hawawu uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase more eggs for sale. Hawawu plans to use the new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La señora Betty tiene un hijo y vive con su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer propietario El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, pues es la única actividad  de la cual obtienen ingresos  para mantener a su familia.  Betty vive en anticretico en la zona  Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.  Es la décima segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la quinta vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Betty has a son and lives with her husband.  He works as a driver, and he has his own vehicle.

She needs the loan for maintenance of the vehicle.  It is the only business activity they have to get income to support their family.

Betty lives in “anticredtico” (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) in the Obispo Bosque zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the 12th time she has worked with IMPRO, and the fifth time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the vehicle her husband drives in order to get more income to support the family.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.es: La señora Jeannette se dedica a la venta de ropa .  El crédito lo necesita para la compra de repuestos para su vehiculo el cual es el medio de transporte para el traslado de su mercadería.
